original: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med pa'o //
translated: The Dharma that is begun and spoken of with eloquence is also non-arising.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs skye ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: gzugs skye ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang /
translated: Form is non-arising, and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-arising. Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are non-arising.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: The perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang skye ba med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang skye ba med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du'ang skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the correct individual awarenesses, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are also non-arising, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects is also non-arising.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: tshe dang ldan @352b pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan @352b pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.

original: brjod pa skye ba med do //
analyzed: brjod pa skye ba med do //
translated: Speech is non-arising.

original: spobs pa skye ba med do //
analyzed: spobs pa skye ba med do //
translated: Eloquence is non-arising.

original: chos skye ba med do //
analyzed: chos skye ba med do //
translated: Dharma is non-arising.

original: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //
translated: The dharmas that are begun and in regard to which eloquence is spoken are also non-arising.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: The aggregates, constituents, sense fields, dependent origination, perfections, factors of awakening, all emptinesses, all meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du skye ba med do //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar du skye ba med do //
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are non-arising.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med do //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is non-arising.

original: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'gro ba lnga po dag tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis 'gro ba lnga po dag tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the five kinds of beings are differentiated by worldly convention,🔽but not ultimately.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no; ;rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no; ;rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is so.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'thob pa dang / mngon par rtogs pa 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as attainment and clear realization exist as worldly conventions,

original: 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha dad kyi /
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga po dag kyang 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis tha dad kyi /
translated: so the five kinds of beings are differentiated by worldly convention,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar don dam par ni las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar don dam par ni las kyi rnam par smin pa'ang med /
translated: it is because ultimately there is no ripening of karma,

original: skye ba'ang med /
analyzed: skye ba'ang med /
translated: no arising,

original: 'gag pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'gag pa'ang med /
translated: no ceasing,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'ang med /
translated: no defilement,

original: rnam par byang ba'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'ang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and no purification.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /🔽tshe dang ldan @353a *//
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa / tshe dang ldan @353a *//
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: pa rab 'byor /🔽ci chos ma skyes pa skye'am /
analyzed: pa rab 'byor / ci chos ma skyes pa skye'am /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,🔽do you think that an unarisen dharma arises,

original: 'on te chos skyes pa skye /
analyzed: 'on te chos skyes pa skye /
translated: or do you think that an arisen dharma arises?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bo ni chos ma skyes pa skye bar yang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: kho bo ni chos ma skyes pa skye bar yang mi 'dod la /
translated: I do not think that an unarisen dharma arises,

original: chos skyes pa skye bar yang mi 'dod do //
analyzed: chos skyes pa skye bar yang mi 'dod do //
translated: nor do I think that an arisen dharma arises.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: khyod chos ma skyes pa gang skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: khyod chos ma skyes pa gang skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: what unarisen dharma do you not think arises?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bo ni gzugs ma skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni gzugs ma skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not think that unarisen form arises,

original: kho bo ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that is not produced is produced.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, I do not assert that the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, all the emptinesses, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / byang chub ma skyes pa 'thob par mi 'dod /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / byang chub ma skyes pa 'thob par mi 'dod /
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, or awakening that is not produced is attained.

original: mngon par rtogs par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not assert that it is realized.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: chos skyes pa gang skye bar mi 'dod /
analyzed: chos skyes pa gang skye bar mi 'dod /
translated: what produced dharma do you not assert is produced?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bo ni gzugs skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni gzugs skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not maintain that form that has arisen is empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: kho bo ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa @353b skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa @353b skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not maintain that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness that have arisen are empty of an intrinsic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra, in the same way,

original: kho bo ni byang chub kyi bar du skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kho bo ni byang chub kyi bar du skyes pa ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa skye bar mi 'dod do //
translated: I do not maintain that up to enlightenment that has arisen is empty of an intrinsic nature.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / ci ma skyes pa'i chos skye'am /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,🔽is an unarisen dharma produced?

original: skyes pa'i chos skye /
analyzed: skyes pa'i chos skye /
translated: Or is a produced dharma produced?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ma skyes pa'ang mi skye la /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'ang mi skye la /
translated: an unarisen dharma is not produced,

original: skyes pa'ang mi skye'o //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: skyes pa'ang mi skye'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and a produced dharma is not produced.🔽If you ask why, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: it is because

original: 'di ltar skyes pa gang yin pa dang / ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de gnyi ga'ang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes pa gang yin pa dang / ma skyes pa'i chos gang yin pa de gnyi ga'ang ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: In this way, that which is produced and that which is not produced are neither conjoined nor disjoined.🔽They are not conjoined and not disjoined.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not conjoined and not disjoined because they are non-production.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs skye ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs skye ba med pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa skye ba med pa dang / de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang /
translated: it is because form is non-production, and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are non-production. Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, and dependent origination are non-production.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: The perfections, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, and in the same vein,

original: lus kyi 'du byed rnams dang / ngag gi 'du byed rnams dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams dang / rnam @354a *//
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed rnams dang / ngag gi 'du byed rnams dang / yid kyi 'du byed rnams dang / rnam @354a *//

analyzed: pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du skye ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: up to and including omniscience, are non-arising.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na brjod pa skye ba med /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na brjod pa skye ba med /

original: spobs pa skye ba med /
analyzed: spobs pa skye ba med /
translated: eloquence is non-arising,

original: chos skye ba med /
analyzed: chos skye ba med /
translated: the Dharma is non-arising,

original: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang dag las brtsams te brjod par spobs pa'i chos de dag kyang skye ba med do //

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor ni /

analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: the applications of mindfulness are empty of any intrinsic nature.

original: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: They do not stand internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: they do not stand externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they are also not apprehended as neither.🔽Similarly, the right efforts,🔽the legs of miraculous power,🔽the faculties,🔽the powers,🔽the branches of awakening,

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /🔽de dag ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste / de dag ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: and the path are empty of any intrinsic nature.🔽They do not stand internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: they do not stand externally,🔽and they are also not apprehended as neither.

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: It is also not apprehended as not both.

original: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: The powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of a basic nature.

original: de dag ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de dag ni nang na'ang mi gnas /
translated: They do not stand internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: they do not stand externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and they are also not apprehended as not both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rang bzhin gyis stong ste /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty of a basic nature.

original: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas //
analyzed: de ni nang na'ang mi gnas //
translated: It does not stand internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi gnas /
translated: it does not stand externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and it is also not apprehended as not both.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong @355b pa'i phyir mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis stong @355b pa'i phyir mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: for that reason all phenomena are non-abiding because they are empty of a basic nature.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod bas gzugs yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod bas gzugs yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: “Thus, Subhūti, should bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections purify form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: They should purify feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
analyzed: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang /
translated: They should purify the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: They should purify up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa /
translated: how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar byed /
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar byed /
translated: purify the path to awakening?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽there is a mundane perfection of generosity

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of generosity.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol @356a *//🔽tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol @356a *// tu phyin pa ni 'jig rten pa'ang yod /
translated: Similarly, there is a mundane perfection of moral discipline, a perfection of patience, a perfection of perseverance, a perfection of concentration, and a perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang yod do //
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of wisdom.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin; 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin; 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the mundane perfection of generosity? What is the supramundane perfection of generosity?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag tu gyur cing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa po dang / sbyin bdag tu gyur cing /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings become donors and benefactors.

original: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / sdug phongs pa dang / 'dren pa dang / slong mo pa zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / sdug phongs pa dang / 'dren pa dang / slong mo pa zas 'dod pa rnams la ni zas /
translated: To mendicants, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, the helpless, and beggars who desire food, they give food.

original: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom /🔽bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa /
analyzed: skom 'dod pa rnams la ni skom / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bzhon pa /
translated: To those who desire drink, they give drink.🔽To those who desire vehicles, they give vehicles.

original: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni gos /🔽me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog /
analyzed: gos 'dod pa rnams la ni gos / me tog 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog /
translated: To those who desire clothing, they give clothing.🔽To those who desire flowers, they give flowers.

original: me tog phreng 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog phreng /🔽spos 'dod pa rnams la ni spos /
analyzed: me tog phreng 'dod pa rnams la ni me tog phreng / spos 'dod pa rnams la ni spos /
translated: To those who desire flower garlands, they give flower garlands.🔽To those who desire incense, they give incense.

original: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni byug pa /
analyzed: byug pa 'dod pa rnams la ni byug pa /
translated: To those who desire ointments, they give ointments.

original: gnas 'dod pa rnams la ni gnas /
analyzed: gnas 'dod pa rnams la ni gnas /
translated: To those who desire dwellings, they give dwellings.

original: mal cha dang stan 'dod pa rnams la ni mal cha dang stan /
analyzed: mal cha dang stan 'dod pa rnams la ni mal cha dang stan /
translated: To those who want bedding and seats, they give bedding and seats.

original: 'tshog chas 'dod pa rnams la ni 'tshog chas /
analyzed: 'tshog chas 'dod pa rnams la ni 'tshog chas /
translated: To those who want clothing, they give clothing.

original: sman 'dod pa rnams la ni sman /
analyzed: sman 'dod pa rnams la ni sman /
translated: To those who want medicine, they give medicine.

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag sbyin par byed cing /
translated: To those who want any human necessities, they give them.

original: bu 'dod pa rnams la ni bu sbyin par byed /🔽bu mo 'dod pa rnams la ni bu mo sbyin par byed /
analyzed: bu 'dod pa rnams la ni bu sbyin par byed / bu mo 'dod pa rnams la ni bu mo sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who want sons, they give sons.🔽To those who want daughters, they give daughters.

original: chung ma 'dod pa rnams la ni chung ma sbyin par byed /
analyzed: chung ma 'dod pa rnams la ni chung ma sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who want wives, they give wives.

original: rgyal srid 'dod pa rnams la ni rgyal srid sbyin par byed /
analyzed: rgyal srid 'dod pa rnams la ni rgyal srid sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who want kingdoms, they give kingdoms.

original: mgo 'dod pa rnams la ni mgo sbyin @356b par byed /
analyzed: mgo 'dod pa rnams la ni mgo sbyin @356b par byed /
translated: To those who want heads, they give heads.

original: mig 'dod pa rnams la ni mig sbyin par byed /
analyzed: mig 'dod pa rnams la ni mig sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who want eyes, they give eyes.

original: yan lag dang nying lag 'dod pa rnams la ni yan lag dang nying lag sbyin par byed /
analyzed: yan lag dang nying lag 'dod pa rnams la ni yan lag dang nying lag sbyin par byed /
translated: To those who want limbs and minor appendages, they give limbs and minor appendages.

original: sha dang / khrag dang / rkang 'dod pa rnams la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang sbyin par byed la de'ang gnas shing yongs su gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: sha dang / khrag dang / rkang 'dod pa rnams la ni sha dang khrag dang rkang sbyin par byed la de'ang gnas shing yongs su gtong bar byed de /
translated: To those who want flesh, blood, or marrow, he gives his flesh, blood, and marrow, and he gives while remaining firm.

original: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du bdag ni sbyin pa byed pa'o //
translated: He thinks, “I am the one who gives.

original: 'di ni len pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'o //
translated: This one is the recipient.

original: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: This is the gift.

original: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni ser sna med pa'o //
translated: I am the one without stinginess.

original: bdag ni sbyin bdag go /
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin bdag go /
translated: I am the one who is generous.

original: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag ni bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: I am the one who gives away all my possessions.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bzhin byed pa'o //
translated: I am the one who does what the Buddha said.

original: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: I am the one who practices the perfection of generosity.”

original: snyam du sems shing sbyin pa de'ang byin nas /
analyzed: snyam du sems shing sbyin pa de'ang byin nas /
translated: And when he has given that gift,

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: he makes common cause with all sentient beings by way of apprehending something.

original: bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di la rang bde bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi sbyin pa'i 'bras bu 'dis sems can 'di dag tshe 'di la rang bde bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: “By the fruit of my generosity, may these sentient beings be happy in this very life,

original: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur cig /
analyzed: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur cig /
translated: and may they pass into nirvāṇa without grasping.”

original: ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
analyzed: ces bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed do //
translated: He dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: de ni chags pa gsum la chags shing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives gifts attached to three attachments.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa ste /
analyzed: bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / gzhan du 'du shes pa dang / sbyin par 'du shes pa ste /
translated: the perception of self, the perception of another, and the perception of giving.

original: chags pa gsum po de dag la chags shing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: chags pa gsum po de dag la chags shing sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: He gives gifts attached to those three attachments.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //🔽ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa @357a *//
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa @357a *//
translated: That is called the mundane perfection of giving.

original: zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the mundane perfection of giving?

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags shing mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las mi g-yo mi 'phags shing mi 'da' ste /
translated: In this way, it does not move out of the mundane, does not transcend it, and does not go beyond it.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the mundane perfection of giving.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of giving?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is the purity of the three spheres.

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the purity of the three spheres?”

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu; 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin pa na /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra, here bodhisattva great beings, when giving a gift,

original: bdag tu mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag tu mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend a self,

original: len par mi dmigs /
analyzed: len par mi dmigs /
translated: do not apprehend a recipient,

original: sbyin par mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: sbyin par mi dmigs shing /
translated: and do not apprehend a gift.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa ste /🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni /
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa la'ang mngon par dga' ba med pa ste / tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu de ni /
translated: They do not delight in its maturation.🔽Venerable Śāriputra, this is the purity of the three spheres

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin no //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin no // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: of bodhisattva great beings.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings give gifts

original: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la stobs par byed kyang sems can thams cad kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sbyin pa de sems can thams cad la stobs par byed kyang sems can thams cad kyang mi dmigs /
translated: and dedicate them to all sentient beings, but they do not apprehend any sentient beings,

original: bdag kyang mi dmigs /
analyzed: bdag kyang mi dmigs /
translated: they do not apprehend a self,

original: sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang mi dmigs la /
translated: and they do not apprehend a gift.

original: sbyin pa de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed cing /
analyzed: sbyin pa de'ang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed cing /
translated: They dedicate that generosity to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: byang chub kyang mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyang mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: And they do not apprehend awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the perfection of generosity that transcends the world.

original: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @357b phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @357b phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the perfection of generosity that transcends the world?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten las g-yo zhing 'phags la 'da' ste /
translated: it is because it moves, rises above, and transcends the world.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin no ////
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de bzhin no ////
translated: Therefore it is called the perfection of generosity that transcends the world. The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration are also like that.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: Eighteenth

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'jig rten pa'i yang yod /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang 'jig rten pa'i yang yod /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽there is also a mundane perfection of wisdom,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang yod de /
translated: and there is a supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the mundane perfection of wisdom?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gis ser sna'i sems tshar bcad do //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bdag gis ser sna'i sems tshar bcad do //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: zhes dmigs pa la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: zhes dmigs pa la gnas nas sbyin pa sbyin par byed de /
translated: here bodhisattva great beings, having settled down on the notion that they have destroyed the thought of stinginess, give gifts.

original: de'ang bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin pa'i 'du shes la gnas shing /
analyzed: de'ang bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin pa'i 'du shes la gnas shing /
translated: And they do so while settled down on the notions of self, sentient beings, and giving.

original: de bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: de bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ste /
translated: They give away all their possessions.

original: dmigs pa la gnas nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa la gnas nas /
translated: Having settled down on an object,

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po'am /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po'am /
translated: they give away outer and inner things,

original: zin pa'am / ma zin pa'am /
analyzed: zin pa'am / ma zin pa'am /
translated: whether appropriated or not appropriated,🔽whether belonging to themselves or to others.

original: ci bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / de sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas shing /
analyzed: ci bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba dang / de sbyangs pa'i yon tan la gnas shing /
translated: and they observe the ascetic practices.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: They observe the focus of body, speech, and mind,

original: bdag tu lta ba la gnas /🔽sems can du lta ba dang / dge bar @358a *//
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba la gnas / sems can du lta ba dang / dge bar @358a *//
translated: and they observe the view of self.

original: lta ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: lta ba la gnas shing /
translated: They observe the view of sentient beings and the view of virtue,🔽and they rely on those paths of the ten virtues and moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag la bsten pa tshul khrims dag sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing byang chub dmigs nas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam de dag la bsten pa tshul khrims dag sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing byang chub dmigs nas /
translated: They make those moral disciplines common to all sentient beings, and they dedicate them to awakening,🔽observing them as objects.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod la /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de bdag la bstod cing gzhan la smod la /
translated: They praise themselves and disparage others,

original: bdag dang sems can dang / bzod par lta ba la gnas shing /
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang / bzod par lta ba la gnas shing /
translated: and they observe the view of self, sentient beings, and patience.

original: sems can thams cad kyis nyes par byas pa bzod par byed la /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis nyes par byas pa bzod par byed la /
translated: They are patient with all the faults of sentient beings,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de'ang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: and they make those roots of virtue common to all sentient beings.

original: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de lus dmigs shing /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / de lus dmigs shing /
translated: They apprehend a body,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs dmigs la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs dmigs la /
translated: apprehend a collection of merit,

original: ye shes kyi tshogs dmigs shing /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs dmigs shing /
translated: apprehend a collection of wisdom,

original: bdag dmigs la sems can rnams dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag dmigs la sems can rnams dmigs te /
translated: apprehend a self, apprehend sentient beings,

original: byang chub dmigs shing /
analyzed: byang chub dmigs shing /
translated: apprehend awakening,

original: brtson 'grus brtsam ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsam ste /
translated: and undertake perseverance.🔽Through that perseverance they undertake, they are conceited.

original: de brtson 'grus brtsam pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / de byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed cing /
analyzed: de brtson 'grus brtsam pa des rlom sems su byed pa dang / de byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms sgom par byed cing /
translated: They cultivate love, compassion, joy, and equanimity,

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la'ang snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la'ang snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: and they also enter into the meditative stabilizations, the clairvoyances, the meditative concentrations, and the meditative absorptions,

original: ldang bar yang byed cing /
analyzed: ldang bar yang byed cing /
translated: and they also rise from them.

original: de dag gi ro myang bar yang byed la /
analyzed: de dag gi ro myang bar yang byed la /
translated: They also experience their taste,

original: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang byed cing /
analyzed: de dag gis rlom sems su'ang byed cing /
translated: and they are conceited about them.

original: dmigs pa'i lta ba @358b can du gyur nas /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i lta ba @358b can du gyur nas /
translated: They become those who have the view of an objective support.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas shing /
translated: They make those roots of virtue common to all sentient beings,

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ni 'jig rten pa'i 'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba de ni 'jig rten pa'i 'o //
translated: and they dedicate them to awakening. That is the mundane perfection.

original: de gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar dmigs /
analyzed: de gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar dmigs /
translated: “They focus on the idea that ‘form is empty.’

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes bya bar dmigs shing /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes bya bar dmigs shing /
translated: They focus on the idea that ‘feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty.’

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi bar du dmigs nas stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi bar du dmigs nas stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
translated: In the same way, they focus on the idea that ‘awakening is empty,’ and they cultivate emptiness.

original: de dmigs pa la spyod cing /
analyzed: de dmigs pa la spyod cing /
translated: They practice with a focus,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas /
translated: and they make those roots of virtue common to all sentient beings,🔽and they dedicate them to awakening.

original: de'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
analyzed: de'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba dang / dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi bsod nams thams cad la rjes su yi rang ba dang /
translated: That is to say, it is the dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by way of apprehending; it is the confession of all misdeeds by way of apprehending; it is the rejoicing in all the merit of oneself and others by way of apprehending;

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir dmigs nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi phyir dmigs nas /
translated: it is the supplicating all the buddhas for the sake of oneself and others by way of apprehending;

original: thabs ma yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / phung po gsum pa'i bsod nams thabs ma yin pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni /
analyzed: thabs ma yin pas sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs pa dang / phung po gsum pa'i bsod nams thabs ma yin pas sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngo ba de ni /
translated: it is the dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by way of apprehending; it is the dedication to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by way of apprehending all the merit of the three collections by oneself and others as common to all sentient beings by way of apprehending;

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the perfection of wisdom of the world.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the supramundane perfection of wisdom?

original: bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @359a *//🔽phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / tshul khrims dang / byang chub mi dmigs te /
analyzed: bdag dang / sems can dang / sbyin par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i shes rab 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir sbyin pa'i pha rol tu @359a *// phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / tshul khrims dang / byang chub mi dmigs te /
translated: The perfection of generosity is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, sentient beings, or the act of giving, and is completely pure of the three spheres.🔽The perfection of moral discipline is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, sentient beings, moral discipline, or awakening, and is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir tshul khrims yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / bzod pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir tshul khrims yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / bzod pa dang / byang chub mi dmigs te /
translated: The perfection of patience is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, patience, or awakening, and is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / lus dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes mi dmigs te /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / lus dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsod nams dang / ye shes mi dmigs te /
translated: The perfection of diligence is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, body, mind, diligence, merit, or wisdom, and is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir /
translated: The perfection of concentration is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, concentration, or the mind, and is completely pure of the three spheres.🔽The perfection of wisdom is purified for the sake of awakening by the perfection of wisdom that does not observe a self, wisdom, or the mind, and is completely pure of the three spheres.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams mi dmigs te /
translated: and they purify the perfection of concentration for the sake of enlightenment, without observing self, sentient beings, meditative stability, meditative absorption, or the attainments.

original: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / sems can thams cad mi dmigs pas byang chub kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas byang chub kyi phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang / sems can thams cad mi dmigs pas byang chub kyi phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa dang /
translated: They purify the perfection of wisdom for the sake of enlightenment, without observing any sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang yongs su bsngo ba dug med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bla na med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba mi mnyam pa dang mnyam pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang /
translated: They dedicate all their roots of virtue to unsurpassed, genuine, and complete enlightenment, with a dedication that is free of poisons, with a dedication that is unsurpassed, with a dedication that is equal to the unequaled, with a dedication that is inconceivable,

original: yongs su bsngo ba mtshungs pa med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dpag tu med pas /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba mtshungs pa med pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba dpag tu med pas /
translated: with a dedication that is incomparable, and with a dedication that is immeasurable.

original: bla @359b na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bla @359b na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa ste /
translated: and dedicates to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //🔽ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // ci'i phyir na /
translated: That is called the supramundane perfection of wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa zhes bya /🔽ci'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa zhes bya / ci'i phyir na /
translated: Why is it called mundane?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called supramundane?

original: de la 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, what is called mundane is

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten du 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten 'grub par byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten dang mnyam pa dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten gyi phyir sbyin pa dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: what makes the world, what creates the world, what is equal to the world, what gives to the world, what does not go beyond the world,

original: gang dag 'jig rten 'byung par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten 'byung par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: what arises in the world, what will arise in the world, what is arising in the world.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those are called mundane.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa gang zhe na /
translated: Here, what is supramundane?

original: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten sel bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gang dag gis sgrol bar byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: gang dag gis 'jig rten sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten sel bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten gang dag gis sgrol bar byed pa dang / gang dag 'jig rten ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag gis 'jig rten las 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Those who liberate the world, those who remove the world, those by whom the world is liberated, those who are not the world, those by whom the world is freed,

original: gang dag 'jig rten las sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du sgrol bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag 'jig rten las sgrol ba dang / gang dag 'jig rten du sgrol bar byed pa ste /
translated: those who liberate the world, those by whom the world is liberated,

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called supramundane.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod pa ni de ltar byang chub kyi lam yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the six perfections in that way purifies the path to enlightenment.”

analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /

translated: are the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.

original: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang /
translated: The four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the emptiness gate of liberation,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: the signlessness gate of liberation, the wishlessness gate of liberation, the emptiness of internal phenomena, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po ste /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, great love, and great compassion.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi lam zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the bodhisattva great beings’ path to awakening.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

analyzed: de pha rol tu phyin pa gang gi skyes bu'i rtsal yin /

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i skyes bu'i rtsal yin no //
translated: it is the power of a person of the perfection of wisdom.

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol @360b tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad bskyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol @360b tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad bskyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the perfection of wisdom gives rise to the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin cing yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni nyan thos kyi chos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yongs su 'dzin cing yang dag par 'dzin par byed pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of wisdom fully grasps and holds the dharmas of the śrāvakas, the dharmas of the pratyekabuddhas, the dharmas of the bodhisattvas, the dharmas of the buddhas, and all wholesome dharmas.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gis kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyad nas /
translated: The past tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas also, having trained in this perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas bar gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas bar gyur to //
translated: fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
analyzed: ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid la bslabs nas /
translated: the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas of the future also, having trained in just this perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na bzhugs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gang dag da ltar phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na bzhugs te /
translated: the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas who at present live, are present, and remain in the world in the worlds of the ten directions

original: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di @361a *//🔽nyid la bslabs nas /
analyzed: 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di @361a *// nyid la bslabs nas /
translated: Those who are present and living now, they too, having trained in this perfection of wisdom,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa na gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur med cing rmongs pa med par gyur na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di bshad pa na gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nem nur med cing rmongs pa med par gyur na /
translated: when this perfection of wisdom is being explained, if a bodhisattva great being is not doubtful or confused,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni; 'di lta ste /
translated: that bodhisattva great being should be known as one who is standing in this,

original: sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad bskyab pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi btang ba'i phyir /
translated: that is, standing in this way, in order to save all beings and not abandon all beings.🔽And that is done by way of not standing.🔽That bodhisattva great being

original: 'di ltar gnas pa 'dis gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas pa 'dis gnas pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: should be known as one who is standing in this,🔽that is, standing in this way, in order to save all beings and not abandon all beings.

original: de'ang mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'ang mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ni /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: And that is done by way of not standing.

original: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that one is not separated from the attention of great compassion.

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: if you say that

original: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bar gnas pa des gnas pa de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: snying rje chen po yid la byed pa'i yid la byed pa de dang ma bral bar gnas pa des gnas pa de byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yin par 'dod na /
translated: a bodhisattva great being is one who is not separated from the attention of great compassion,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: de ltar na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then all sentient beings are bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Why is that? Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad ni yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad ni yid la byed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because all sentient beings are not separated from attention.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: legs @361b so; ;legs so //
analyzed: legs @361b so; ;legs so //
translated: excellent, excellent!

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas don de nyid yongs su bzung ba ni /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus yang dag pa'i tshig brjod pas don de nyid yongs su bzung ba ni /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra has taken up the meaning with the right words

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: dmigs su phebs so //
analyzed: dmigs su phebs so //
translated: they are apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya /
analyzed: sems can med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya /
translated: because of the nonexistence of beings, mental activity should be known to be nonexistent.

original: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya /
analyzed: sems can stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya /
translated: Because of the emptiness of beings, mental activity should be known to be emptiness.

original: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya /🔽sems can ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya zhing /
analyzed: sems can dben pa'i phyir yid la byed pa dben par rig par bya / sems can ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya zhing /
translated: Because of the isolation of beings, mental activity should be known to be isolated.🔽Because of the naturelessness of beings, mental activity should be known to be natureless.

original: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And because of the non-manifestation of beings, mental activity should be known to be non-manifesting.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya /
translated: because of the nonexistence of form, mental activity should be known to be nonexistent.

original: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa nyid du rig par bya /
translated: Because form is emptiness, one should know that mental activity is emptiness.

original: gzugs dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya /
translated: Because form is isolated, one should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya /
analyzed: gzugs ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya /
translated: Because form is essenceless, one should know that mental activity is essenceless.

original: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Because form is not fully awakened, one should know that mental activity is not fully awakened.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, because feeling, perception, volitional forces, and consciousness do not exist, one should know that mental activity does not exist.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa @362a *//🔽nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa stong pa @362a *// nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because consciousness is emptiness, one should know that mental activity is emptiness.

original: rnam par shes pa dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dben pa nyid kyi phyir yid la byed pa dben pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Because consciousness is isolated, one should know that mental activity is isolated.

original: rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa ngo bo nyid med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, you should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are essenceless.🔽You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.

original: rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.🔽You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / bden pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang /
translated: You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du med pa'i phyir /
translated: all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.

original: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.🔽You should know that mental activity is essenceless because the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the truths, the factors of awakening, the perfections, all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations,🔽all the dhāraṇī gateways, and up to the knowledge of all aspects are not fully awakened.🔽You

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dben pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: the knowledge of all aspects being void, the knowledge of all aspects being without an intrinsic nature, and the non-arising of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba med par rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be known that mental activity does not arise.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang / yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gnas pa 'di dang / yid la byed pa 'di dang ma bral lo //
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: zhes kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: zhes kho bo smra'o //
