translated: for this reason, I say that the bodhisattva great beings are not separated from this state and this mental activity.🔽”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa @362b rab 'byor la legs so //🔽zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa @362b rab 'byor la legs so // zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Then the Lord gave his approval to the venerable Su­bhūti:🔽“Excellent, Su­bhūti!

original: rab 'byor legs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor legs so //
translated: Excellent, Su­bhūti!

original: legs so // 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
analyzed: legs so // 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthus /
translated: In this way, through the power of the Tathā­gata,

original: ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: “Just as you have taught, so should you teach the perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos kyang ji ltar khyod kyis bstan pa de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom just as you have taught.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When the venerable Subhūti explained this chapter, the perfection of wisdom,

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos te /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam pa drug tu rab tu g-yos te /
translated: this great billionfold world system shook in six ways:

original: g-yos / rab tu g-yos /🔽kun tu rab tu g-yos so //
analyzed: g-yos / rab tu g-yos / kun tu rab tu g-yos so //
translated: it shook, shook strongly,🔽and shook intensely;🔽it quivered, quivered strongly,🔽and quivered intensely;

original: 'gul / rab tu 'gul /🔽kun tu rab tu 'gul to //🔽ldeg / rab tu ldeg /🔽kun tu rab tu ldeg go; 'khrugs /
analyzed: 'gul / rab tu 'gul / kun tu rab tu 'gul to // ldeg / rab tu ldeg / kun tu rab tu ldeg go; 'khrugs /
translated: it trembled, trembled strongly,🔽and trembled intensely;🔽it quaked, quaked strongly,🔽and quaked intensely;

original: rab tu 'khrugs /🔽kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so //🔽'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
analyzed: rab tu 'khrugs / kun tu rab tu 'khrugs so // 'ur 'ur / rab tu 'ur 'ur /
translated: it roared, roared strongly,🔽and roared intensely;🔽it rumbled, rumbled strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //
analyzed: kun tu rab tu 'ur 'ur ro //
translated: and rumbled intensely.

original: chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
analyzed: chem chem / rab tu chem chem /
translated: trembling,🔽trembling strongly,

original: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo //🔽shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho /
analyzed: kun tu rab tu chem chem mo // shar phyogs dma' na nub phyogs mtho /
translated: trembling intensely,🔽the east sank and the west rose,

original: nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho /🔽lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho /
analyzed: nub phyogs dma' na shar phyogs mtho / lho phyogs dma' na byang phyogs mtho /
translated: the west sank and the east rose,🔽the south sank and the north rose,

original: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho /🔽dbus dma' na mtha' mtho /
analyzed: byang phyogs dma' na lho phyogs mtho / dbus dma' na mtha' mtho /
translated: the north sank and the south rose,🔽the center sank and the edge rose,

original: mtha' dma' na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
analyzed: mtha' dma' na dbus mtho bar gyur to //
translated: and the edge sank and the center rose.

original: de nas de'i tshe /
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe /
translated: Then at that time

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad do //
translated: the Blessed One smiled.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor @363a *//
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor @363a *//
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti

original: gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: said this to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu gang lags /
translated: “Blessed One, what is the cause of the smile?

original: rkyen gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen gang lags /
translated: What is the condition?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams mi mjed 'di nang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston pa de bzhin du /
translated: “Subhūti, just as the perfection of wisdom is being taught in this Sahā world system,

original: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: in the same way, in the east, in countless

original: grangs med pa dag na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par mdzad do //🔽de bzhin du phyogs bcu khor yug kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: grangs med pa dag na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par mdzad do // de bzhin du phyogs bcu khor yug kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: In the past, in the presence of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings were taught this very perfection of wisdom.

original: grangs med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: grangs med pa dag na de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston par mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, in the worlds in the ten directions, in infinite, countless world systems, the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas are teaching this very perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa 'di bshad pa na /
translated: When the venerable Subhūti had explained this teaching on the perfection of wisdom,

original: lha dang mi'i skye dgu rnams las srog chags 'bum nyi khris mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i skye dgu rnams las srog chags 'bum nyi khris mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur to //
translated: among the multitudes of gods and humans, 120,000 beings attained receptivity to the nonarising of phenomena.

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis /
translated: In all the world systems of the ten directions, those Blessed Buddhas

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa mdzad @363b na'ang sems can dpag tu med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di nyid ston pa mdzad @363b na'ang sems can dpag tu med /
translated: are teaching this very perfection of wisdom to the bodhisattva great beings.

original: grangs med pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: grangs med pa rnams kyis /
translated: And in those, countless,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: innumerable sentient beings are producing the thought of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yum /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yum /
translated: The Mother of all Buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: The Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor gyi le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: The Chapter of the Elder Subhūti,

original: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa gcig pa'o ////
translated: The Twenty-First

original: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal po chen po gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu 'khor de nyid du 'dus par gyur to //
translated: Then all the great kings who dwell in this great trichiliocosm, together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods, assembled in that very retinue.

original: de bzhin du lha'i dbang po brgya byin rnams dang / rab 'thab bral rnams dang / yongs su dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha'i dbang po brgya byin rnams dang / rab 'thab bral rnams dang / yongs su dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang / tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don rnams kyang /
translated: Similarly, Śakra, lord of the gods, Suyāma, Santuṣita, Sunirmita, Vaśavartin, and the Brahma gods,

original: tshangs pa'i bar dag dang lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bar dag dang lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to //
translated: up to the highest gods, assembled together.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang dag ji snyed 'khod pa rnams kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to //🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu de dag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' @364a *//
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang dag ji snyed 'khod pa rnams kyang lha'i bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dang lhan cig tu 'dus par gyur to // rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu de dag gi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa dang / sum cu rtsa gsum dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' @364a *//
translated: All the gods from the Brahma realm up to the Pure Abodes, as many as there are in this great trichiliocosm, gathered together with many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods.

original: dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed dang / tshangs pa dang / gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The light of the bodies of the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, which arises from the ripening of their karma, and the light of the bodies of the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa, Yāmā, Tuṣita, Nirmāṇa­rata, and Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realms, and the light of the bodies of the gods of the Brahmakāyika realm up to the Śuddhāvāsa realm, which arises from the ripening of their karma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gro'o //
translated: do not approach even a hundredth part of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.

original: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
analyzed: stong gi cha dang / 'bum gyi cha dang / bye ba phrag 'bum gyi cha dang / grangs dang / cha dang / bgrang ba dang / dpe dang / rgyur yang mi bzod do //
translated: It is not even a fraction, a hundredth, a thousandth, a hundred thousandth, a ten millionth, a hundred millionth, a billionth, a ten billionth, a trillionth, a hundred thousandth of a trillionth, a ten trillionth, a hundred trillionth, a quintillionth, a ten quintillionth, a hundred quintillionth, or even a count, a fraction, a comparison, or an example of the light of the Tathāgata’s nature.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi gan na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi gan na /
translated: Compared to the light of the Tathāgata’s nature,

original: lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od de dag thams cad ni lham me ma yin /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od de dag thams cad ni lham me ma yin /
translated: all the light of the bodies of the gods that arises from the ripening of the karma of the gods is not radiant,

original: lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ne ma yin /
translated: is not clear,

original: lhang nge ma yin no //
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin no //
translated: and is not bright.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od ni /
translated: The light of the Tathāgata

original: de dag gi nang na mchog tu snang ngo //🔽phul du snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi nang na mchog tu snang ngo // phul du snang ngo //
translated: shines forth as supreme among them.🔽It shines forth as the best.

original: khyad par du 'phags par snang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags par snang ngo //
translated: It shines forth as preeminent.

original: rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
analyzed: rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
translated: It shines forth as excellent, unexcelled, and unsurpassed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / dzambu chu bo'i gser gyi gan na lcags nag po ni ka ba tshig pa bzhin du lham me ma yin /
analyzed: dper na / dzambu chu bo'i gser gyi gan na lcags nag po ni ka ba tshig pa bzhin du lham me ma yin /
translated: Compared to the gold of the Jambū River, black iron is not radiant,

original: lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: lhan ne ma yin /
translated: is not clear,

original: lhang nge ma yin no //
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin no //
translated: It is not radiant.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi gan na lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od de dag thams cad kyang lham me ma yin /🔽lhan ne ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi gan na lha rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i lus kyi 'od de dag thams cad kyang lham me ma yin / lhan ne ma yin /
translated: compared to the natural light of the Tathāgata, the bodies of the gods, which are the result of the evolution of their karma, are not radiant,🔽are not bright,

original: lhang nge ma yin te /
analyzed: lhang nge ma yin te /
translated: are not clear,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od ni de dag gi nang na mchog @364b tu snang ngo //🔽phul du snang ngo //🔽khyad par du 'phags par snang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od ni de dag gi nang na mchog @364b tu snang ngo // phul du snang ngo // khyad par du 'phags par snang ngo //
translated: and the light of the Tathāgata appears as the best of them,🔽appears as the most excellent,🔽appears as the most sublime,

original: rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
analyzed: rab dang / rab mchog dang / gya nom pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gong na med par snang ngo //
translated: appears as the highest, the utmost, the supreme.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams dang / 'thab bral rnams dang / dga' ldan rnams dang / 'phrul dga' rnams dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed rnams dang /
translated: In this great billionfold world system, all the gods of the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm, the gods of the Trayas­triṃśa realm, the gods of the Yāma realm, the gods of the Tuṣita realm, the gods of the Nirmāṇa­rata realm, the gods of the Para­nirmita­vaśa­vartin realm,

original: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad btsun pa rab 'byor la chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dus te /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi bar gyi lha'i bu gang dag 'khod pa de dag thams cad btsun pa rab 'byor la chos nyan pa'i phyir 'dus te /
translated: and the gods of the Śuddhāvāsa realm have gathered together in order to listen to the doctrine from the venerable Su­bhūti.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa nyan par 'dod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa nyan par 'dod na /
translated: They wish to listen to the teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya /
translated: Venerable Su­bhūti!🔽How should bodhisattva great beings abide in the perfection of wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang yin /
translated: What is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni ji ltar bslab par bya /
translated: How should a bodhisattva great being train in the perfection of wisdom?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Subhūti said to Śakra, mighty lord of the gods:

original: koo shi ka /🔽de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la /🔽yid la zung zhig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @365a *//
analyzed: koo shi ka / de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la / yid la zung zhig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @365a *//
translated: “Kauśika,🔽therefore listen well and hard and pay attention, and I will tell you what the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings is, and how bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom, and how bodhisattva great beings should train in the perfection of wisdom, by the power of the Buddha, by the blessing of the Buddha.”

original: chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba dag bstan par byas /
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya ba dag bstan par byas /
translated: “Very well, Subhūti,” said Śakra, mighty lord of the gods, and he listened to the venerable Subhūti as instructed.

original: lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang /🔽bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyis shig /
analyzed: lha'i bu gang dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa de dag gis kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyis shig /
translated: Those sons of gods who have not given rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening should give rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: gang dag yang dag pa skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: gang dag yang dag pa skyon med pa la zhugs pa de dag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i mthu med do //
translated: Those who have entered the faultless state are not capable of giving rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽Because they have severed the continuity of saṃsāra.

original: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro; ;'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
analyzed: de dag gis 'khor ba'i rgyun gyi mtshams bcad pa'i phyir ro; ;'on kyang gal te de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na /
translated: However, if they were to give rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening,

original: kho bo ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad mi byed pas de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi bar chad mi byed pas de dag la'ang rjes su yi rang ste /
translated: I would not create obstacles to their virtuous activities and would rejoice in them.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la lhag par dmigs par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams las khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos rnams la lhag par dmigs par bya'o //
translated: “You should focus on the qualities that are superior to the superior qualities.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings?

original: koo shi ka /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs mi rtag @365b par yid la bya'o //🔽sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can dang /🔽'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bur yid la bya ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka /'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas gzugs mi rtag @365b par yid la bya'o // sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bur yid la bya ste /
translated: Kauśika, here bodhisattva great beings with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects should pay attention to form as impermanent,🔽as suffering, as selfless, as empty, as a disease, as a tumor, as a dart, as misery, as alien, as disintegrating, as not self, as having the nature of being burned up,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
translated: as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being destroyed, as having the nature of being overturned, as having the nature of being split apart, as having the nature of being burned, as having the nature of being cut, as having the nature of being broken, as having the nature of being crushed, as having the nature of being burned up, as having the nature of being

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams dang /🔽chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag par yid la byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / de bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams mi rtag par yid la byed do //
translated: the sensory element of sights as painful, the sensory element of visual consciousness as painful, and so too to the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds, and the sensory element of auditory consciousness, as well as to the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the tongue, the sensory element of tastes, and the sensory element of gustatory consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the body, the sensory element of tangibles, and the sensory element of tactile consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the mental faculty, the sensory element of mental phenomena, and the sensory element of mental consciousness.🔽He should attend to the sensory element of the eyes as empty,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can dang /🔽'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bur yid la bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / nad dang / 'bras dang / zug rngu dang / sdig pa dang / gzhan la rag las pa dang / 'jig pa'i chos can dang / mi brtan pa dang / rab tu 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'go ba'i nad lta bur yid la bya ste /
translated: the sensory element of sights as empty, the sensory element of visual consciousness as empty, and so too to the sensory element of the ears, the sensory element of sounds, and the sensory element of auditory consciousness, as well as to the sensory element of the nose, the sensory element of odors, and the sensory element of olfactory consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the tongue, the sensory element of tastes, and the sensory element of gustatory consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the body, the sensory element of tangibles, and the sensory element of tactile consciousness, and likewise to the sensory element of the mental faculty, the sensory element of mental phenomena, and the sensory element of mental consciousness.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis yid la byed do //
translated: He should attend to the sensory

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya bar yid la bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya bar yid la bya ste /
translated: And with the generation of the mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, one should keep in mind the statement, “Conditioned by ignorance, there are karmic formations.”

original: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong par yid la byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong par yid la byed do //
translated: And one should keep in mind that these are impermanent, suffering, selfless, peaceful, void, and empty.

original: 'du @366a *// byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
analyzed: 'du @366a *// byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /
translated: Conditioned by karmic formations, there is consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: Conditioned by consciousness, there is name and form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug /
translated: Conditioned by name and form, there are the six sense spheres.

original: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /🔽reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba /
translated: Conditioned by the six sense spheres, there is contact.🔽Conditioned by contact, there is feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: Conditioned by feeling, there is craving.🔽Conditioned by craving, there is grasping.

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: Conditioned by grasping, there is becoming.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: Conditioned by becoming, there is birth.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung ste /
translated: grief, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, this entire great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong par yid la byed de /
analyzed: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong par yid la byed de /
translated: He contemplates it as impermanent, suffering, empty, selfless, peaceful, and void.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: He does so without apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i yid la bya ba dag gis ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag ste /
translated: With attention connected with the knowledge of all aspects, he knows that ignorance ceases and therefore formations cease.

original: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang; zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par yid la bya'o //
analyzed: de'ang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang; zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par yid la bya'o //
translated: They should be contemplated as impermanent, as suffering, as selfless, as peaceful, as void, as empty, as signless, as wishless, and as having nothing to do with any volitional activity.

original: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
analyzed: 'du byed 'gags pas rnam par shes pa 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of volitional activity, consciousness ceases.

original: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'gags pas ming dang gzugs 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of consciousness, name and form cease.

original: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs 'gags pas skye mched drug 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of name and form, the six sense spheres cease.

original: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg @366b pa 'gag /
analyzed: skye mched drug 'gags pas reg @366b pa 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of the six sense spheres, contact ceases.

original: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
analyzed: reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of contact, feeling ceases.

original: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
analyzed: tshor ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of feeling, craving ceases.

original: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
analyzed: sred pa 'gags pas len pa 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of craving, grasping ceases.

original: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
analyzed: len pa 'gags pas srid pa 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of grasping, becoming ceases.

original: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas skye ba 'gag /
translated: With the cessation of becoming, birth ceases.

original: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag ste /
analyzed: skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'gag ste /
translated: With the cessation of birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, suffering, mental anguish, and turmoil cease.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'ba' zhig po 'di 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, this great mass of pure suffering will cease.

original: de'ang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yid la byed de /
analyzed: de'ang bdag med pa dang / zhi ba dang / dben pa dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yid la byed de /
translated: Moreover, he should attend to it as being without a self, as being peaceful, as being isolated, as being emptiness, as being signless, as being wishless, and as being without formation.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed do //
translated: Moreover, he should do so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi bsgom ste /
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings endowed with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects should cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: Moreover, they should cultivate them by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang /
translated: Similarly, they cultivate the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous action, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad bsgom ste /
translated: the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: They cultivate these by way of not apprehending anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan @367a *// yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: gzhan @367a *// yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: “Furthermore, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings with the thought that is conjoined with the knowledge of all aspects practice the perfection of giving,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
translated: and they practice by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, with the mind of awakening endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, they practice the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis spyod do //
translated: And they practice in such a way that they do not apprehend anything.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi tshe /
translated: furthermore, when

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar chos dang / chos rnams sbyor bar byed cing /🔽rtog sbyor du byed la /🔽yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos dang / chos rnams sbyor bar byed cing / rtog sbyor du byed la / yongs su rdzogs par byed cing /
translated: they connect phenomena with phenomena🔽and make them into a conceptual connection.🔽They make them complete

original: yongs su khyab par byed de /
analyzed: yongs su khyab par byed de /
translated: and pervade them.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad ni bdag med cing /
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad ni bdag med cing /
translated: All these phenomena are without a self

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: and are free from a self and what belongs to a self.

original: zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
analyzed: zhes so sor rtog par byed do //
translated: He should investigate in this way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang chub kyi sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin la /
translated: It is because the thought of the roots of virtue of a bodhisattva great being is not accompanied by the thought of awakening,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems dang 'grogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: and the thought of the dedication is not accompanied by the thought of the roots of virtue.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang @367b chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni byang @367b chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: the thought of the roots of virtue does not exist and is not found in the thought of awakening,

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /🔽byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs / byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de ni yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs /
translated: and the thought of awakening does not exist and is not found in the thought of the roots of virtue.🔽The thought of awakening does not exist and is not found in the thought of dedication,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs la /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs la /
translated: and the thought of dedication does not exist and is not found in the thought of awakening.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med; byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems la med /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sems la med; byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang byang chub kyi sems la med /
translated: That thought of the root of merit is not in the thought of the root of merit, and that thought of enlightenment is not in the thought of enlightenment.

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med de /
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de'ang yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med de /
translated: That thought of dedication is not in the thought of dedication.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang de ltar chos thams cad la so sor rtog kyang /
analyzed: gang de ltar chos thams cad la so sor rtog kyang /
translated: when one thus discriminates all dharmas,

original: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med cing mi dmigs pa de ni /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang mngon par zhen pa med cing mi dmigs pa de ni /
translated: one does not settle down on any dharma at all, and does not apprehend it.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //🔽de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no // de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: That is the perfection of wisdom of a bodhisattva, a great being.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, Śatakratu, head of the gods, asked the venerable Su­bhūti as follows:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Reverend Su­bhūti,

original: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'grogs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems dang mi 'grogs pa yin /
translated: how is it that the thought of dedication does not accompany the thought of enlightenment?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs pa yin /🔽ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems dang mi 'grogs pa yin / ji ltar na yongs su bsngo ba'i sems byang chub kyi sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: How is the thought of the mind of awakening not associated with the thought of dedicating?🔽How is the thought of dedicating not in the mind of awakening and not apprehended in it?

original: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngo ba'i sems la med cing mi dmigs pa yin /
translated: How is the mind of awakening not in the thought of dedicating and not apprehended in it?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems @368a *//
analyzed: yongs su bsngo ba'i sems gang yin pa de ni sems @368a *//
translated: the thought of dedicating is not a thought,

original: ma yin la /
analyzed: ma yin la /
translated: and

original: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
translated: the mind of awakening is also not a thought.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin la /
translated: Thus, that which is not a thought is inconceivable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin pas /
translated: and that which is inconceivable is also not a thought.

original: sems ma yin pas ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo bar mi byed la /
analyzed: sems ma yin pas ni sems ma yin par yongs su bsngo bar mi byed la /
translated: That which is not a thought does not dedicate that which is not a thought,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pas ni /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pas ni /
translated: and that which is inconceivable

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par yongs su bsngo bar mi byed de /
translated: does not dedicate that which is inconceivable.

original: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ltar na sems ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Thus, whatever is not mind

original: bsam mi khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: bsam mi khyab pa yin la /
translated: is inconceivable.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa gang yin pa de'ang sems ma yin te /
translated: And whatever is inconceivable is also not mind.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: this is the perfection of wisdom of bodhisattva great beings.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Then the Lord

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //🔽rab 'byor / legs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to // rab 'byor / legs so //
translated: said to the venerable Subhūti:🔽“Subhūti, excellent, excellent!

original: legs so // rab 'byor /🔽gang khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing /
analyzed: legs so // rab 'byor / gang khyod byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ston cing /
translated: Subhūti,🔽it is excellent that you teach the perfection of wisdom to bodhisattva great beings and inspire them.

original: spro ba bskyed pa ni yang khyod legs so; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: spro ba bskyed pa ni yang khyod legs so; ;rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni byas pa gzo bar bgyi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis ni byas pa gzo bar bgyi ste /
translated: “Lord, I must repay the kindness

original: byas pa mi gzo bar mi bgyi lags so //
analyzed: byas pa mi gzo bar mi bgyi lags so //
translated: and not not repay the kindness.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa spyad pa mdzad pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i spyod pa spyad pa mdzad pa na /
translated: In this way, the Blessed One, when previously practicing the conduct of a bodhisattva mahāsattva,

original: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thad na de dag gi nyan @368b thos rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams shing rjes su bstan te /
analyzed: sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi thad na de dag gi nyan @368b thos rnams kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams shing rjes su bstan te /
translated: in the presence of the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas of the past, instructed and taught the six perfections to their śrāvakas.

original: yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /🔽yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: He perfectly taught them,🔽caused them to take them up,🔽extolled them,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyis shing gzhug pa bgyis te bzhag nas /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyis shing gzhug pa bgyis te bzhag nas /
translated: and delighted in them.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpar gyur pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de la bslabs te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur pas pha rol tu phyin pa drug po de la bslabs te /
translated: having trained in those six perfections while being a bodhisattva,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas lags so //
translated: you fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi /🔽rjes su bstan par bgyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag cag gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams par bgyi / rjes su bstan par bgyi /
translated: In the same way, we too should instruct the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections,🔽we should teach them,🔽we should demonstrate them,

original: yang dag par bstan par bgyi /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du stsal par bgyi /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan par bgyi / yang dag par 'dzin du stsal par bgyi /
translated: we should make them take them up,🔽we should make them enthusiastic,🔽we should make them rejoice,🔽we should take them up and establish them.🔽We should instruct the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections, we should teach them,🔽we should demonstrate them,🔽we should make them take them up,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bgyi /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par bgyi /
translated: we should make them enthusiastic,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyi /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyi /
translated: we should make them rejoice,

original: gzung bar bgyi zhing bzhag par bgyi lags so //
analyzed: gzung bar bgyi zhing bzhag par bgyi lags so //
translated: we should take them up and establish them.

original: bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams shing rjes su bstan te /
analyzed: bdag cag gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams pha rol tu phyin pa drug la gdams shing rjes su bstan te /
translated: Those who have been led and established in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening by our instructing the bodhisattva great beings in the six perfections, teaching them,

original: yang dag par bstan /🔽yang dag par 'dzin du stsal /
analyzed: yang dag par bstan / yang dag par 'dzin du stsal /
translated: demonstrating them,🔽making them take them up,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: making them enthusiastic,🔽making them rejoice,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyis shing btsud de bzhag pa rnams ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bgyis shing btsud de bzhag pa rnams ni /
translated: taking them up and establishing them,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur lags so //
translated: will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhuti🔽

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras @369a *//🔽so; ;koo shi ka /
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces smras @369a *// so; ;koo shi ka /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to Śatakratu, head of the gods:

original: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la /
analyzed: de'i phyir legs par rab tu nyon la /
translated: “Therefore, Kauśika,

original: yid la zung zhig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar gnas par mi bya ba dag bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yid la zung zhig dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar gnas par mi bya ba dag bshad par bya'o //
translated: listen carefully and well and take it to heart, and I will tell you how bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom and how they should not stand in it.”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: form is empty of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is empty of consciousness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de; koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de; koo shi ka /
translated: The emptiness of form, the emptiness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang mig ni mig gis stong /
translated: further, the eye is empty of the eye,

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong /
translated: the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty of the thinking mind,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na mig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the eye and the emptiness of the ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva—all are not two, nor are they divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems @369b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems @369b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: a bodhisattva great being should thus stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang sa'i khams ni sa'i khams kyis stong /
translated: further, the earth element is empty of the earth element,

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang; rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong /
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang; rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis stong /
translated: the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element are empty of the consciousness element,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de /🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ltar na sa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de / koo shi ka /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the earth element, the emptiness of the water element, the emptiness of the fire element, the emptiness of the wind element, the emptiness of the space element, the emptiness of the consciousness element, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong /🔽de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang ma rig pa ni ma rig pas stong /🔽de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi ni rga shis stong /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the earth element, the emptiness of the water element, the emptiness of the fire element, the emptiness of the wind element, the emptiness of the space element, the emptiness of the consciousness element, and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two, nor are they divided.

original: ma rig pa 'gag pa ni ma rig pa 'gag pas stong /🔽de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi 'gag pa ni rga shi @370a *//
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gag pa ni ma rig pa 'gag pas stong / de bzhin du 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs dang / skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / sred pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa dang / skye ba dang / rga shi 'gag pa ni rga shi @370a *//
translated: The cessation of ignorance is empty of the cessation of ignorance.

original: 'gag pas stong /
analyzed: 'gag pas stong /
translated: Similarly, the cessation of conditioning, consciousness, name and form, the six sense fields, contact, feeling, craving, grasping, becoming, birth, and aging and death is empty of the cessation of aging and death.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / ma rig pa 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rga shi'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rga shi 'gag pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / ma rig pa 'gag pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rga shi'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / rga shi 'gag pa'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of ignorance, the emptiness of the cessation of ignorance, up to the emptiness of aging and death, the emptiness of the cessation of aging and death,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings should thus stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: further, the perfection of giving

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
translated: is empty of the perfection of giving.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: A bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the emptiness of the perfection of moral discipline, the emptiness of the perfection of patience, the emptiness of the perfection of perseverance, the emptiness of the perfection of concentration,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni @370b gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong /🔽dngos po med pa'o ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni @370b gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //🔽koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong /🔽dngos po med pa'o ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /🔽byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: and the emptiness of the perfection of wisdom, and the emptiness of the bodhisattva—these are not two, nor are they divided.

original: de ltar na nang stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na nang stong pa nyid kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: Thus, the emptiness that is the emptiness of internal phenomena and the emptiness that is the emptiness of external phenomena, up to and the emptiness that is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, and the emptiness of bodhisattvas, are not two nor divided, nor are they cut off nor differentiated.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika!

original: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong /🔽yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: Moreover, the applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness,🔽the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar ni /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar ni /
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, up to and including the distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong /
translated: the emptiness of the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and the emptiness of the emptiness of great compassion is not great compassion.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: “Kauśika, the emptiness of the emptiness of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment is not the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the emptiness of the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //🔽koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ltar na dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do // koo shi ka /
translated: and the emptiness of the emptiness of great compassion is not great compassion.

original: gzhan @371a *// yang ting nge 'dzin rnams ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: gzhan @371a *// yang ting nge 'dzin rnams ni ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis stong /
translated: “Kauśika, the emptiness of the emptiness of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment is not the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the emptiness of the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,

original: gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyis stong /
translated: the emptiness of the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness of the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: the emptiness of the emptiness of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,🔽and the emptiness of the emptiness of great compassion is not great compassion.🔽“Kauśika, the emptiness of the emptiness of the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment is not the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment,🔽and the emptiness of the emptiness of the ten powers of the tathāgatas,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness of the four fearlessnesses,🔽the emptiness of the emptiness

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: Therefore, the emptiness of the meditative stabilities, the emptiness of the dhāraṇī gateways, and the emptiness of the bodhisattvas are not two and cannot be divided into two.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pas stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyan thos kyi theg pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pas stong /
translated: the Śrāvaka Vehicle is empty of the Śrāvaka Vehicle,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas stong /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas stong /
translated: the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle is empty of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po ni theg pa chen pos stong /
analyzed: theg pa chen po ni theg pa chen pos stong /
translated: the Great Vehicle is empty of the Great Vehicle,

original: nyan thos ni nyan thos nyid kyis stong /🔽rang sangs rgyas ni rang sangs rgyas nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: nyan thos ni nyan thos nyid kyis stong / rang sangs rgyas ni rang sangs rgyas nyid kyis stong /
translated: śrāvakas are empty of śrāvakas,🔽pratyekabuddhas are empty of pratyekabuddhas,

original: sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni sangs rgyas nyid kyis stong /
translated: buddhas are empty of buddhas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpas stong ste /
translated: and bodhisattvas are empty of bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na nyan thos kyi theg pa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / nyan thos kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / theg pa chen po'i bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the śrāvaka vehicle, the emptiness of the śrāvaka, the emptiness of the Mahāyāna, the emptiness of the Buddha,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med do //
translated: and the emptiness of the bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /
translated: Furthermore, up to the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems @371b dpas stong ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems @371b dpas stong ste /
translated: and a bodhisattva is empty of a bodhisattva.

original: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de; koo shi ka /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med de; koo shi ka /
translated: Thus, the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects and the emptiness of a bodhisattva are not two and are not divided.🔽Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva should stand in the perfection of wisdom like that.”

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable monk Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bya ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par mi bya ba yin /
