translated: how should the bodhisattva mahāsattva stand in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: here the bodhisattva mahāsattva should not stand in form as an objective support.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stand in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as an objective support.

original: mig la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stand in the eyes as an objective support.

original: gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stand in a form as an objective support.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the eye consciousness,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not abide in the eye contact,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not abide in the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par @372a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // chos rnams dang / yid kyi rnam par @372a *//
translated: Similarly, one should not abide in the ear, nose, tongue, body, or mind,🔽one should not abide in the mental consciousness,

original: shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not abide in the mental contact, one should not abide in the feeling that arises from the condition of mental contact.

original: sa'i khams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide in the earth element,

original: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: the water element, the fire element, the wind element, the space element, and the consciousness element.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stand in the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, the path, the ten powers of a tathāgata, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: the distinct attributes of a buddha, or in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: He should not stand in the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the result of once-returners, the result of non-returners, or the state of a worthy one, or in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the knowledge of a knower of paths, or in the knowledge of all aspects, or in the knowledge of a knower of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na gzugs zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: they should not stand in the notion that ‘form is permanent’ or ‘form is impermanent.’

original: rnam @372b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam @372b pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the notion that ‘all dharmas up to the knowledge of all aspects are permanent’ or ‘all dharmas up to the knowledge of all aspects are impermanent.’

original: de ltar na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the notion that ‘the result of stream enterer is permanent’ or ‘the result of stream enterer is impermanent.’

original: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the notion that ‘all dharmas up to the knowledge of all aspects are permanent’ or ‘all dharmas up to the knowledge of all aspects are impermanent.’

original: gzugs rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rtag ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the notion that ‘form is happiness’ or ‘form is suffering.’

original: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang /
translated: Likewise, one should not abide in the notion that form is impermanent, or that it is happiness, or that it is suffering, or that it is a self, or that it is not a self, or that it is calm, or that it is not calm,

original: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang /🔽smon pa med ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: or that it is empty, or that it is not empty, or that it has a sign, or that it is signless, or that it is having aspirations, or that it is without aspirations.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang /
translated: In the same way, one should not abide in the notion that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is permanent, or that it is impermanent, or that it is happiness, or that it is suffering, or that it is a self, or that it is not a self,🔽or that it is calm, or that it is not calm, or that it is empty, or that it is not empty, or that it has a sign, or that it is signless, or that it is having aspirations, or that it is without aspirations.

original: bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang /🔽mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang / mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “solitary” or “not solitary,” “arisen” or “not arisen,” “ceased” or “not ceased,” “defiled” or “undefiled,” “free” or “not free.”

original: @373a *// de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: @373a *// de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: In the same way, they should not abide with a notion of the constituents of the body, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rtag ces bya ba dang / mi rtag ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya ba'i bar du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are permanent or impermanent, or have aspirations or do not have aspirations, they are not training in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /🔽gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: koo shi ka / gzhan yang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: Kauśika,

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas ni 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: they should not stand in the idea that ‘the result of stream enterer is differentiated by the uncompounded,’ and similarly, they should not stand in the idea that ‘the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, or unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening is differentiated by the uncompounded.’

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'dus ma byas kyis rab tu phye ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: up to and including the knowledge of all aspects, is revealed by the unconditioned.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni sbyin gnas so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One who has entered the stream is a worthy recipient of gifts.

original: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sbyin gnas @373b so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni sbyin gnas @373b so zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one who is a once-returner, one who is a non-returner, one who is an arhat, a pratyekabuddha, and a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened, perfect buddha is a worthy recipient of gifts.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dang po la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings should not stand on the first level by way of apprehending something.

original: de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i bar la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bcu pa'i bar la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: In the same way, up to they should not stand on the tenth level by way of apprehending something.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: gnas pa yod na g-yo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa yod na g-yo bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there were abiding, there would be movement.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te /🔽sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed pa la gnas te / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: further, bodhisattva great beings, standing in the first production of the thought,🔽should not stand in the idea that they should perfect the perfection of giving, and so on, up to should not stand in the idea that they should perfect the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not stand in the idea that they should perfect the applications of mindfulness, and so on, up to should not stand in the idea that they should perfect the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the notion that they should perfect the four right efforts, the four legs of miraculous power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of awakening, and the noble eightfold path.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la 'jug par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the notion that they should enter into the secure state of a bodhisattva.

original: @374a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: @374a *// byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs nas phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the notion that, having entered into the secure state of a bodhisattva, they should stand in the irreversible stage.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mngon par shes pa lnga yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand in the notion that they should perfect the five clairvoyances.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas te /🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa lnga la gnas te / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med /
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings, standing in the five superknowledges of the bodhisattvas,

original: grangs med pa rnams su 'gro bar bya zhing /
analyzed: grangs med pa rnams su 'gro bar bya zhing /
translated: should go to the buddhafields, countless, innumerable, to worship and honor the lord buddhas and to listen to the Dharma.

original: chos thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du bsgrub cing /
analyzed: chos thos nas kyang de bzhin nyid du bsgrub cing /
translated: Having heard the Dharma, they should practice it just as they have heard it,

original: gzhan dag la'ang bstan par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la'ang bstan par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: and they should teach it to others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ci 'dra ba de lta bu dag bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ci 'dra ba de lta bu dag bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings should not stand in the idea that ‘I will accomplish such buddhafields of the lord buddhas.’

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad de /
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings should practice the perfection of wisdom

original: sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽byang chub sems @374b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
analyzed: sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // byang chub sems @374b dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med /
translated: “They should not stand in a conceptualization of the thought, ‘I will bring beings to maturity in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.’🔽“Bodhisattva great beings should go to countless,

original: grangs med pa dag tu song zhing /
analyzed: grangs med pa dag tu song zhing /
translated: immeasurable world systems

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la me tog dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag gis bkur stir bya /🔽bla mar bya /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la me tog dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / me tog phreng dang / byug pa dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dag gis bkur stir bya / bla mar bya /
translated: and honor the tathāgatas, worthy ones, perfectly complete buddhas with flowers, incense, perfume, flower garlands, creams, clothes, parasols, flags, and banners,

original: brjed par bya /
analyzed: brjed par bya /
translated: and should revere them,🔽should praise them,

original: mchod par bya zhing /
analyzed: mchod par bya zhing /
translated: and should make offerings to them,

original: ras bcos bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dag gis /
analyzed: ras bcos bu bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum phrag du ma dag gis /
translated: and with many hundreds of thousands of quintillions of calico cloths

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi sku la gsol bar bya'o snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can dpag tu med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag gi sku la gsol bar bya'o snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can dpag tu med /
translated: “I will don the armor of the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones.”

original: grangs med / tshad med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: grangs med / tshad med pa dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dgod par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will establish countless, innumerable sentient beings in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos mig lnga bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: “I will accomplish the five eyes:

original: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sha'i mig dang / lha'i mig dang / shes rab kyi mig dang / chos kyi mig dang / sangs rgyas kyi mig bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: the flesh eye, the deva eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.”

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish all meditative stabilizations.”

original: ting nge 'dzin gang dang gang gis rnam par rtse bar 'dod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dang nges rnam par rtse @375a *//
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang dang gang gis rnam par rtse bar 'dod pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dang nges rnam par rtse @375a *//
translated: Whatever meditative absorption they wish to play with, that meditative absorption they play with.🔽

original: bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bar bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “He should not stand with the idea that he should play with this or that meditative absorption.

original: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzungs kyi sgo thams cad bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “He should not stand with the idea that he should accomplish all the dhāraṇī gateways.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The bodhisattva great beings should not stand with the idea that they should accomplish the ten tathāgata powers.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yongs su rdzogs par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand with the idea that they should perfect the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang; snying rje chen po bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “They should not stand with the idea that they should accomplish great love and great compassion.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lus la bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis lus la bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish the thirty-two major marks of a great being on my body” — one should not abide in that way.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu lus la bsgrub par bya'o snyam du dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “I will accomplish the eighty minor marks on my body” — one should not abide in that way.🔽“The one who follows by faith and the one who follows by the teachings are the eighth” — one should not abide in that way.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba dang / re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba ni brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba dang / re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The one who is obstructed at most for seven rebirths is a stream enterer” — one should not abide in that way.

original: rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / bar chad gcig pa zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The one who is born in the same lineage and the one who has one obstruction” — one should not abide in that way.

original: tshe zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa ni gang zag mgo mnyam pa zhes bya bar dmigs @375b pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshe zad pa dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa ni gang zag mgo mnyam pa zhes bya bar dmigs @375b pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “The one who has exhausted life and the one who has exhausted afflictions is the one who is equal in fortune” — one should not abide in that way.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa ni bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who is entering the stream will attain parinirvāṇa in the intermediate state,” and so on up to:

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong pa ni 'jig rten 'dir lan gcig 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong pa ni 'jig rten 'dir lan gcig 'ongs nas sdug bsngal mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who is a once-returner will put an end to suffering after returning once to this world,”

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who is on the path to realizing the fruit of non-return,”

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni der yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who is a non-returner will attain parinirvāṇa there,”

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “One who is on the path to realizing the fruit of arhatship,”

original: dgra bcom pa ni 'di nyid la phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: and the arhat is one who attains complete nirvana in the realm of nirvana without the remainder of the aggregates in this very life.

original: rang sangs rgyas zhes bya bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas /

analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi la gnas te /

original: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du gnas par 'gyur ba de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug par bya'o snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

analyzed: bdag gi tshe'i tshad ni dpag tu med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

original: bdag gi mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan re re'ang bsod nams brgyas yongs su grub par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan re re'ang bsod nams brgyas yongs su grub par 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam du'ang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: “Each of my thirty-two major marks will be perfected by a hundred merits.”

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gi khyon yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag dang / de @376b bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag gi khyon ci tsam pa de tsam du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: I should not stand in the idea that the extent of my buddha-field will be the extent of the world systems of the east equal to the sands of the Ganges river, and similarly in the south, west and north.

original: bdag gi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdo rje las grub par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //

translated: “One should not abide with the notion that ‘the sound of the perfection of giving will not occur,’ and likewise, ‘the sound of the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom will not occur.’

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur pa dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang /

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba dang / rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
translated: “One should not abide with a notion of the eightfold noble path, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar yang dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not abide with a notion of a stream enterer, once-returner, non-returner, worthy one, pratyekabuddha, bodhisattva, or buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis /
translated: And why?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the tathāgatas, arhats, genuinely perfect buddhas, having attained manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment, do not apprehend any phenomenon at all.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar @377b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar @377b shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva great beings should not stand in the perfection of wisdom by way of apprehending anything.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra thought this:

original: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya snyam mo //
translated: “Well then, how should the bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom?”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu'i sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti, having understood in his mind the thoughts occurring to the mind of the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci la gnas snyam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci la gnas snyam /
translated: Where does the Tathāgata stand?”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci la'ang mi gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni ci la'ang mi gnas pa yin la /
translated: the Tathāgata does not stand anywhere at all.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang ci la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi thugs kyang ci la'ang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: the mind of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not abide in anything at all.

original: de ni gzugs la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de ni gzugs la'ang mi gnas /
translated: It does not abide in form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la'ang mi gnas /
translated: nor does it abide in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams la'ang mi gnas /
translated: It does not abide in the conditioned realm,

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la'ang mi gnas shing /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la'ang mi gnas shing /
translated: nor does it abide in the unconditioned realm.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang mi gnas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang mi gnas /
translated: Similarly, it does not abide in the eighteen distinct qualities of the Buddha,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: up to and including omniscience.

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: When this was said, the venerable Subhūti

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @378a *//
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par @378a *//
translated: how is the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One

original: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzugs la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas gzugs la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The perfect Buddha does not dwell in form,

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor does he not dwell in it.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: He does not dwell in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness,

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: nor does he not dwell in them.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Up to and he does not dwell in the knowledge of all aspects,🔽nor does he not dwell in it.

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya ste /
translated: In that way, bodhisattva great beings should dwell in the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par bya'o ////
translated: bodhisattva great beings should dwell in the perfection of wisdom in that way, by way of not dwelling.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: Chapter : The Nonapprehending of All Dharmas🔽Then some sons of gods in the assembly thought this:

original: de nas 'khor de las lha'i bu kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor de las lha'i bu kha cig 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then, some of the gods in the retinue thought this:🔽

original: gnod sbyin rnams kyi gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / gnod sbyin gyis smras pa dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi tshig gang dag yod pa de dag ni brjod na shes par yang rung gi /
analyzed: gnod sbyin rnams kyi gnod sbyin gyi skad dang / gnod sbyin gyis smras pa dang / gnod sbyin gyis brjod pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi tshig gang dag yod pa de dag ni brjod na shes par yang rung gi /
translated: the language of the yakṣas, the speech of the yakṣas, the expression of the yakṣas, the words of the yakṣas, are understandable when spoken.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: But this—

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa smra ba dang / brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa 'di ni shes par mi rung ngo snyam mo //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa smra ba dang / brjod pa dang / 'chad pa dang / ston pa 'di ni shes par mi rung ngo snyam mo //
translated: namely, the elder Subhūti’s teaching, expression, explanation, and demonstration of the perfection of wisdom—is not understandable.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti,

original: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas lha'i bu de dag la smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas lha'i bu de dag la smras pa /
translated: having known with his own mind the thoughts occurring to the minds of those gods, said to those gods,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

original: gang smras pa @378b shes par mi rung ngam /
analyzed: gang smras pa @378b shes par mi rung ngam /
translated: is what was said not understandable?”

original: lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The gods said,

original: 'phags pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: 'phags pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: shes par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: shes par mi rung ngo //
translated: it is not understandable.”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

original: 'di ltar yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge gcig kyang ma brjod de /
translated: because not a single letter was spoken.

original: gang ma brjod pa de ni thos par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang ma brjod pa de ni thos par mi rung ngo //
translated: What is not spoken is not heard.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge med pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni yi ge med pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is without syllables.

original: de la ni nyan pa'am ston pa'ang med la /
analyzed: de la ni nyan pa'am ston pa'ang med la /
translated: There is neither listening nor teaching in it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la'ang yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la'ang yi ge med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfect awakening of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly awakened buddhas is also without syllables.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas sprul pa sprul pa mdzad de /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis sangs rgyas sprul pa sprul pa mdzad de /
translated: For example, a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened buddha emanates a buddha emanation.

original: 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag kyang mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dag kyang mngon par sprul la /
translated: He also emanates the four retinues of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen.

original: sprul pa des sprul pa'i 'khor bzhi po dag la chos bstan par gyur na lha'i bu dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: sprul pa des sprul pa'i 'khor bzhi po dag la chos bstan par gyur na lha'i bu dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: If that emanation teaches the Dharma to the four emanated retinues, divine princes, what do you think?

original: de la sus kyang ci'ang bstan pa'am /
analyzed: de la sus kyang ci'ang bstan pa'am /
translated: No one can teach it to anyone.🔽🔽

original: mnyan pa yod snyam mam /🔽lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /🔽btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: mnyan pa yod snyam mam / lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Who could teach anything here, or listen, or understand?

original: de ni med do //🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de ni med do // rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: The gods said, Venerable Subhūti, there is no one.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Subhūti said, Gods, it is just so.

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang sprul pa lta bu ste /🔽de la sus kyang bshad pa med cing sus kyang mnyan pa med la /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang sprul pa lta bu ste / de la sus kyang bshad pa med cing sus kyang mnyan pa med la /
translated: All phenomena are like a magical creation.

original: sus kyang shes pa med do //🔽lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: sus kyang shes pa med do // lha'i bu dag /
translated: Here, there is no one who teaches, no one who listens, and no one who understands.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / mi gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @379a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / mi gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag @379a *//
translated: The gods said, Gods, it is just so.

original: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa zhig mthong bar gyur na lha'i bu dag 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽de la sus kyang bshad pa'am /
analyzed: par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos ston pa zhig mthong bar gyur na lha'i bu dag 'di ji snyam du sems / de la sus kyang bshad pa'am /

original: mnyan pa'am / shes pa yod snyam mam /🔽lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa /🔽btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: mnyan pa'am / shes pa yod snyam mam / lha'i bu rnams kyis smras pa / btsun pa rab 'byor /

translated: The gods said, Venerable Subhūti, there is no one.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /

original: de bzhin du chos thams cad kyang rmi lam lta bu ste /

analyzed: phra ba ma yin no //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin /

analyzed: mig ni zab pa ma yin /

analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni zab pa ma yin /

original: phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phra ba ma yin no //

original: gzugs ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs ni zab pa ma yin /

analyzed: phra ba ma yin no //

analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni zab pa ma yin /

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
translated: they are not subtle.

original: sa'i khams ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: sa'i khams ni zab pa ma yin /

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /

analyzed: chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: The water element, fire element, wind element, space element, and consciousness element are not profound;

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
