analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: The perfection of giving is not profound;

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
translated: it is not subtle.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab pa ma yin /🔽phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni zab pa ma yin / phra ba ma yin /
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are not deep and not subtle.

original: nang stong pa nyid ni zab pa ma yin /🔽phra ba ma yin /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni zab pa ma yin / phra ba ma yin / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of internal phenomena is not deep and not subtle.

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of the intrinsic defining characteristic, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities are not deep and not subtle.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni zab pa ma yin /🔽phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni zab pa ma yin / phra ba ma yin /
translated: The applications of mindfulness are not deep and not subtle.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang /
translated: Similarly, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers,

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @380b pa bco brgyad ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres @380b pa bco brgyad ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: The four assurances, the four unhindered discernments, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not profound,

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
translated: they are not subtle.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: All the meditative stabilities and all the dhāraṇī gateways are not profound,

original: phra ba ma yin /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin /
translated: they are not subtle.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: Up to and the knowledge of all aspects is not profound,

original: phra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: phra ba ma yin no //
translated: it is not subtle.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi rang bzhin ni zab pa ma yin /
translated: it is because up to the knowledge of all aspects is not profound by nature,

original: phra ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: phra ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: it is not subtle.

original: 'o na chos bstan pa 'di la gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: 'o na chos bstan pa 'di la gzugs su btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Then the thought occurred to those gods, “Well then, in this teaching of the Dharma, is form not even imputed?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes par btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Is feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness not even imputed?

original: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung bar btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the elements, the sense fields, and dependent origination also not imputed?

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are the perfections and the factors of awakening also not imputed?

original: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Are all the emptinesses, all the meditative stabilizations, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha also not imputed?

original: chos bstan pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: chos bstan pa 'di la rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bur btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: In this teaching of the Dharma, is the result of stream enterer also not imputed?

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid du btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid du btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Is the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, and the state of a pratyekabuddha also not imputed?

original: byang chub sems dpar btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpar btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Is a bodhisattva also not imputed?

original: sangs rgyas nyid du btags @381a *//🔽pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du btags @381a *// pa'ang med dam /
translated: Is it that there is no designation of a buddha?

original: byang chub tu btags pa'ang med dam /
analyzed: byang chub tu btags pa'ang med dam /
translated: Is it that there is no designation of awakening?

original: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med dam snyam mo //
analyzed: yi ge rnams su btags pa'ang med dam snyam mo //
translated: Is it that there is no designation of the letters?”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /🔽lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas / lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Su­bhūti, having understood the thoughts that had occurred to the minds of those gods,

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de de bzhin no //
translated: said to those gods, “Divine princes!🔽It is just so!

original: de de bzhin te /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub ni brjod du med cing /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi byang chub ni brjod du med cing /
translated: It is just as you have thought!

original: bsnyad du med pa ste /
analyzed: bsnyad du med pa ste /
translated: The awakening of the tathāgatas is inexpressible and indescribable.

original: de ni sus kyang mnyan du med cing shes par byar med do //
analyzed: de ni sus kyang mnyan du med cing shes par byar med do //
translated: It is not something that anyone can hear or understand.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes!

original: de ltar na gang dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de dag gis kyang bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na gang dag rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la gnas par 'dod pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de dag gis kyang bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ngo //
translated: In that case, those who wish to abide in the result of stream enterer, and those who wish to actualize the result of stream enterer, should not fail to rely on this acceptance.

original: gang dag lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang dag dgra bcom pa nyid dang / gang dag rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / gang dag sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de dag gis kyang bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang dag lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang dag phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / gang dag dgra bcom pa nyid dang / gang dag rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / gang dag sangs rgyas nyid mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa de dag gis kyang bzod pa 'di la mi brten du mi rung ste /
translated: Those who wish to realize the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the fruit of arhatship, the state of a pratyekabuddha, or the state of buddhahood should not fail to rely on this acceptance.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bsnyad du med pa dang / mnyan du med par de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems dang po bskyed phyin chad bsnyad du med pa dang / mnyan du med par de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas par bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: bodhisattva great beings should abide in the perfection of wisdom in this way, from the first production of the thought of awakening onward, without speaking and without listening.”

original: brgya byin gyi le'u dang po zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
analyzed: brgya byin gyi le'u dang po zhes bya ste nyi shu rtsa gnyis pa'o ////
translated: This was the twenty-second chapter, “Śakra,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: @381b de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: @381b de nas lha'i bu de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the divine princes had this thought:

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa ji lta bu dag tu 'dod par bya snyam mo //
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor la chos nyan pa ji lta bu dag tu 'dod par bya snyam mo //
translated: What kind of Dharma listener should I expect?

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis lha'i bu de dag gi sems kyi yongs su rtog pa sems kyis shes nas /
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti, knowing in his own mind the thoughts occurring to the minds of those gods,

original: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: lha'i bu de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to those gods,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Gods,

original: bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bur 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la chos nyan pa ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu lta bur 'dod par bya'o //
translated: you should expect a Dharma listener to be like an illusory person.

original: bdag la chos nyan pa ni sprul pa lta bur 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la chos nyan pa ni sprul pa lta bur 'dod par bya ste /
translated: You should expect a Dharma listener to be like an emanation.

original: de dag ni cung zad kyang nyan pa med cing /🔽kun chub par byed pa med la /
analyzed: de dag ni cung zad kyang nyan pa med cing / kun chub par byed pa med la /
translated: They do not listen to anything at all,🔽they do not understand anything,

original: mngon sum du byed pa med do //🔽de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa med do // de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
translated: and they do not actualize anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: ” Then those gods said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /🔽ci sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor / ci sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,🔽are those sentient beings also like an illusion?

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin nam /
translated: Are those Dharma listeners also like an illusion?

original: sems can de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin la /
translated: Those sentient beings are also like magical creations.

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin nam /
translated: Are those who listen to the Dharma also like magical creations?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Divine princes,🔽it is so!

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin la /
translated: Those sentient beings are also like illusions.

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma are also like illusions.

original: sems can de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin la /
translated: Those sentient beings are also like magical creations.

original: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: chos nyan pa de dag kyang sprul pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Those who listen to the Dharma are also like magical creations.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: sems can rnams ni rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin te /
translated: sentient beings are like dreams and like illusions.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: form is also like a dream and like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @382a *//
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / @382a *//
translated: feeling, perception,

original: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: mental formations, and consciousness are also like a dream and like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: mig kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: mig kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The eye is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: In the same way, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the mind are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: form is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and thoughts are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: eye consciousness, eye contact, and the feelings that arise from eye contact are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'ang rmi lam lta bu dang /🔽sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Likewise, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses, and the mental contact and the feeling that arises from the mental contact are like a dream and like an illusion.

original: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: spyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The perfection of generosity is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang /🔽sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patient acceptance, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative concentration, and the perfection of wisdom are like a dream and like an illusion.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Inner emptiness is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma @382b lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma @382b lta bu yin no //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are like a dream and like an illusion.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: The right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, and the eightfold noble path, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are like a dream and like an illusion.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: The result of stream enterer is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: A stream enterer is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / dgra bcom pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: the fruit of once-returner, the once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the non-returner, the state of an arhat, and the arhat are like a dream, like an illusion.

original: rang byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rang byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Solitary awakening is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: A solitary buddha is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //
translated: Supreme, perfect awakening is like a dream, like an illusion.

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no //🔽de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin no // de nas lha'i bu de dag gis /
translated: Buddhahood is like a dream, like an illusion.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the gods said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: sangs rgyas nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid kyang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu yin na /
translated: if buddhahood is like a dream, like an illusion,

original: ci mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes @383a *//
analyzed: ci mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes @383a *//
translated: “Do you also say that nirvāṇa is like a dream and like an illusion?”

original: smra'am / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: smra'am / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: kho bo ni mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes smra ste /🔽lha'i bu dag gal te /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na'ang de'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: kho bo ni mya ngan las 'das pa'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o zhes smra ste / lha'i bu dag gal te / mya ngan las 'das pa bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa'i chos 'ga' zhig yod na'ang de'ang rmi lam lta bu dang / sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: I say that nirvāṇa is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: zhes kho bo smra'o //
analyzed: zhes kho bo smra'o //
translated: Divine princes, if there were any dharma that was superior to nirvāṇa, I would say that it is like a dream and like an illusion.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Divine princes, why is that?

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: 'di ltar rmi lam gang yin pa dang / sgyu ma gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam gang yin pa dang / sgyu ma gang yin pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because a dream, an illusion, and nirvāṇa are not two and cannot be divided into two.”🔽“Subhūti, you have spoken well of this profound topic.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo dgal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dang / tshe dang ldan pa k'a tya'i bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / tshe dang ldan pa moo dgal gyi bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa gsus po che dang / tshe dang ldan pa k'a tya'i bu chen po dang / tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po dang /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra, the venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, the venerable Mahākauṣṭhila, the venerable Mahākātyāyana, the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyani­putra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong phrag du ma dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'od srung chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po stong phrag du ma dag gis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: the venerable Mahākāśyapa, and many thousands of bodhisattva great beings said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti!

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: This transcendent perfection of wisdom is so profound,

original: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to see,

original: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba /
translated: so difficult to comprehend,

original: 'di ltar zhi ba /🔽'di ltar gya nom pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhi ba / 'di ltar gya nom pa /
translated: so peaceful,🔽so sublime,

original: 'di ltar phra ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba /
translated: so subtle,

original: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
translated: so non-differentiated,

original: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /🔽'di ltar mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa / 'di ltar mkhas pa /
translated: so not within the domain of sophistry,🔽so learned,

original: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
translated: so exalted,

original: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur ba @383b su dag yod /
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur ba @383b su dag yod /
translated: Who are those wise ones, those sagacious ones who will take up this profound perfection of wisdom as it has been taught?

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis nyan thos chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: When this had been said, the venerable Su­bhūti addressed those great śrāvakas and those great bodhisattva beings as follows:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: “Venerable ones!

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: Those irreversible great bodhisattva beings will take up this profound transcendent perfection of wisdom,

original: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: which is so difficult to see,

original: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba /🔽'di ltar zhi ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba / 'di ltar zhi ba /
translated: which is so difficult to realize,🔽which is so peaceful,

original: 'di ltar gya nom pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gya nom pa /
translated: which is so sublime,

original: 'di ltar phra ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba /
translated: which is so subtle,

original: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
translated: which is not other,

original: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /🔽'di ltar mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa / 'di ltar mkhas pa /
translated: which is not the domain of sophistry,🔽which is so wise,

original: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
translated: and which is so exalted.

original: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the wise and the intelligent will take up this topic that is to be known.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag gam /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i gang zag gam /
translated: It is for those persons who have seen the truths,

original: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa'am /
translated: or for those who are arhats with exhausted outflows,

original: brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: brnag pa yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
translated: or for those who have completed their vows,

original: sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa'am /🔽sangs rgyas bye ba phrag mang po las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal ba la lhag par bya ba byas pa'am / sangs rgyas bye ba phrag mang po las dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'am /
translated: or for those who have served the victors of the past,🔽or for those sons or daughters of good family who have generated roots of virtue with many hundreds of thousands of buddhas,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'i rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: or for those who are assisted by spiritual friends.

original: rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: Those sons or daughters of good family will take up this perfection of wisdom, which is so profound,

original: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bar dka' ba /
translated: which is so difficult to see,

original: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba; 'di ltar zhi ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs par dka' ba; 'di ltar zhi ba /
translated: which is so difficult to realize, which is so peaceful,

original: 'di ltar gya nom pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gya nom pa /
translated: which is so sublime,

original: 'di ltar phra ba /
analyzed: 'di ltar phra ba /
translated: which is so subtle,

original: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan ma yin pa /
translated: which is not other,

original: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa /🔽'di ltar mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtog ge'i spyod yul ma yin pa / 'di ltar mkhas pa /
translated: which is not the domain of sophistry,🔽which is so wise,

original: 'di ltar shin tu @384a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu @384a *//
translated: which is so very

original: 'phags pa / 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phags pa / 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba 'di len par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Noble one, the wise and the learned should accept this as something to be known.

original: de dag ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag ni gzugs stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Noble sir, those who take up this skill in means of the wise and the noble will not conceptualize that form is empty.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not conceptualize that emptiness is form.🔽They will not conceptualize that feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness is empty.

original: stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not conceptualize that emptiness is feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.🔽They will not conceptualize that form is signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not conceptualize that the signless is form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, and consciousness are signless.

original: mtshan ma med pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa rnam par shes pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that signlessness is consciousness.🔽They will not entertain the idea that physical forms are aspirationless.

original: smon pa med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs skye ba med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that aspirationlessness is physical forms.🔽They will not entertain the idea that physical forms are non-arising.

original: skye ba med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽gzugs 'gag pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // gzugs 'gag pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that non-arising is physical forms.🔽They will not entertain the idea that physical forms are unceasing.

original: 'gag pa med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa gzugs so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that unceasingness is physical forms.

original: @384b de bzhin du zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @384b de bzhin du zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya ba dang / mi dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, they will not entertain the concepts of “peaceful” and “not peaceful” or “isolated” and “not isolated.”

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the concepts of “feeling,” “perception,” “formation,” and “consciousness” as being “without wishes.”

original: smon pa med pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa rnam par shes pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the concepts of “consciousness” and “without wishes.”

original: de bzhin du skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, they will not entertain the concepts of “unborn,” “unceased,” “peaceful,” and “isolated.”

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang /
translated: Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways, and similarly, the result of stream enterer,

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning,

original: rnam pa @385a *//
analyzed: rnam pa @385a *//
translated: arhatship, and individual enlightenment are also like that.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as empty.🔽They do not conceive of emptiness as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mtshan ma med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // mtshan ma med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as signless.🔽They do not conceive of signlessness as the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smon pa med do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid smon pa med do zhes bya ba rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not conceive of the knowledge of all aspects as wishless.

original: smon pa med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that the knowledge of all aspects is wishless.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'dus byas kyi khams stong zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // 'dus byas kyi khams stong zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that the knowledge of all aspects is non-production, non-stopping, peaceful, and void.🔽They will not entertain the idea that the compounded element is empty.

original: stong pa nyid 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'dus byas kyi khams mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mtshan ma med pa 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // 'dus byas kyi khams mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // mtshan ma med pa 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that emptiness is the compounded element.🔽They will not entertain the idea that the compounded element is signless.🔽They will not entertain the idea that signlessness is the compounded element.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams smon pa med do zhes bya par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams smon pa med do zhes bya par rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that the compounded element is wishless.

original: smon pa med pa 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa 'dus byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that the conditioned element is wishless.

original: de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi khams skye ba med ces bya ba @385b dang; 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'dus ma byas kyi khams stong zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus byas kyi khams skye ba med ces bya ba @385b dang; 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // 'dus ma byas kyi khams stong zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they will not entertain the idea that the conditioned element is non-arising, non-ceasing, peaceful, or void.🔽They will not entertain the idea that the unconditioned element is empty.

original: stong pa nyid 'dus ma byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽'dus ma byas kyi khams mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //🔽mtshan ma med pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'dus ma byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // 'dus ma byas kyi khams mtshan ma med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro // mtshan ma med pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams so zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that emptiness is the unconditioned element.🔽They will not entertain the idea that the unconditioned element is signless.🔽They will not entertain the idea that the signless is the unconditioned element.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams smon pa med do zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not entertain the idea that the unconditioned element is wishless.

original: smon pa med pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smon pa med pa 'dus ma byas kyi khams zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as ‘aspirationless. ’

original: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas kyi khams skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dus ma byas kyi khams skye ba med ces bya ba dang / 'gag pa med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / dben zhes bya bar rnam par rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, they will not conceptualize the unconditioned element as ‘non-arisen, ’ ‘non-ceased, ’ ‘peaceful, ’ or ‘isolated. ’

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Divine princes,

original: rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rnam grangs des na /
translated: for this reason

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ltar zab pa /
translated: this perfection of wisdom, which is so deep,

original: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar shin tu 'phags pa /
translated: so sublime,

original: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba'i bar 'di la len par byed pa ni su'ang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar mkhas pa dang / mdzangs pas rig par bya ba'i bar 'di la len par byed pa ni su'ang med do //
translated: and which is to be known by the learned and the wise, is not appropriated by anyone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'dir chos 'ga' yang ma bshad /🔽ma brjod / ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir chos 'ga' yang ma bshad / ma brjod / ma bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because here no dharma has been taught,🔽no dharma has been explained, and no dharma has been indicated.

original: ji ltar 'dir chos 'ga' yang ma bshad ma brjod /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir chos 'ga' yang ma bshad ma brjod /
translated: Just as here no dharma has been taught, no dharma has been explained, and no dharma has been indicated,

original: ma bstan pa de ltar ji ltar 'di len par byed pa'i sems can su'ang med do //
analyzed: ma bstan pa de ltar ji ltar 'di len par byed pa'i sems can su'ang med do //
translated: in the same way, here there are no sentient beings who appropriate it.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽tshe dang ldan @386a *//
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // tshe dang ldan @386a *//
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: in this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are revealed in detail,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgya cher bstan cing /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rgya cher bstan cing /
translated: namely, the Śrāvaka Vehicle, the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle, and the Vehicle of the Perfectly Awakened One.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: And in order to take possession of the bodhisattva great beings, the generation of the first thought,

original: sems bcu pa bskyed pa'i bar dag kyang bstan la /
analyzed: sems bcu pa bskyed pa'i bar dag kyang bstan la /
translated: up to the generation of the tenth thought is taught,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam 'di lta ste /
translated: and the bodhisattva path is taught, namely,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom;

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of awakening, and the eightfold path of the noble ones;

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang bstan cing /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag kyang bstan cing /
translated: the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: He taught this so that the bodhisattva great beings would be taken care of.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams rdzus te skye bar 'gyur @386b ba dang / de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa rnams rdzus te skye bar 'gyur @386b ba dang / de bzhin du mngon par shes pa yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur zhing /
translated: and in the same way they are not deprived of the higher cognitions, and

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis 'dod na /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dag gis 'dod na /
translated: they accomplish the wholesome roots with which,

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: if they wish, they go from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / mchod par byed par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu dag 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos gang thos pa de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la bsti stang du bya ba dang / bla mar bya ba dang / brjod par bya ba dang / mchod par byed par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba de lta bu dag 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las chos gang thos pa de /
translated: and they honor, venerate, praise, and worship those lord buddhas, and they hear the Dharma from those lord buddhas, and having heard the Dharma they do not doubt or waver about it, and they progress to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang brjed par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med cing /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang brjed par mi 'gyur ba dang / rnam par g-yeng ba med cing /
translated: and until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, they will never forget it, and they will always be in meditative equipoise, without distraction,

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur ba dang / thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang / rgyun mi chad pa'i spobs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i spobs pa dang / rigs pa'i spobs pa dang / 'brel pa'i spobs pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu mnyam par bzhag par 'gyur ba dang / thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa dang / rgyun mi chad pa'i spobs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i spobs pa dang / rigs pa'i spobs pa dang / 'brel pa'i spobs pa dang /
translated: and in a manner of meditative equipoise, and they will have unimpeded eloquence, uninterrupted eloquence, eloquence in meditative equipoise, logical eloquence, connected eloquence,

original: don dang ldan pa'i spobs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba dag kyang bstan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i spobs pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba dag kyang bstan pa ma yin nam /
translated: eloquence endowed with meaning, and eloquence that is superior to all worlds.🔽”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / de de bzhin te /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin no //
analyzed: de de bzhin no //
translated: it is just as it is.

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin te; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin te; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: In this perfection of wisdom the three vehicles are revealed in detail,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'ang @387a *//🔽rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'ang @387a *// rgya cher bstan to //
translated: namely the vehicle of the Disciples, the vehicle of the Bodhisattvas, and the vehicle of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: And so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: And in order to take hold of the Bodhisattvas, the great beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan te /
translated: the perfection of wisdom reveals to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, the special eloquence which is superior to all the worlds.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan to //
translated: And that is revealed by way of nonapprehending.

original: ci zhig mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis she na /
analyzed: ci zhig mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis she na /
translated: By way of nonapprehending what?

original: bdag mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / gzugs mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: bdag mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / gzugs mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
translated: the way of not apprehending a self, up to the way of not apprehending a knower and a seer, the way of not apprehending form, the way of not apprehending feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness,

original: mig mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / sa'i khams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang /
analyzed: mig mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / sa'i khams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams dang / nam mkha'i khams dang /
translated: the way of not apprehending the eyes, the way of not apprehending the ears, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind, the way of not apprehending the earth element, the way of not apprehending the water element, the way of not apprehending the fire element, the way of not apprehending the wind element, the way of not apprehending the space element,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: the way of not apprehending the consciousness element, the way of not apprehending the perfection of giving, the way of not apprehending the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / dngos po med pa'i @387b ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / nang stong pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / dngos po med pa'i @387b ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
translated: the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, the transcendent perfection of wisdom, the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang /
translated: the applications of mindfulness, the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan to; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad mi dmigs pa'i tshul dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan to; ;de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are taught by way of not apprehending them, up to the knowledge of all aspects is taught by way of not apprehending it.”🔽Then venerable Śāriputra

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to venerable Subhūti,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las theg pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan /
translated: why are the three vehicles taught in this perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending them?

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Why is it that the bodhisattva great beings are taken up?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bstan /
translated: and up to “the bodhisattva great beings’ special eloquence that is superior to all worlds” are taught by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: because of inner emptiness🔽the three vehicles are extensively taught by way of not apprehending anything.🔽Because of outer emptiness,🔽because of inner and outer emptiness,🔽because of the emptiness of emptiness,🔽because of great emptiness,🔽because of ultimate emptiness,🔽because of the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,🔽because of the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena,🔽because of the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽because of the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,🔽because of the emptiness of nonrepudiation,🔽because of the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽because of the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽because of the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽because of the emptiness of nonapprehending,🔽because of the emptiness of nonentities,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: and because of the emptiness of the entityness of nonentities,🔽the three vehicles are extensively taught by way of not apprehending anything.”🔽“Venerable Subhūti,🔽because of the emptiness of emptiness🔽the three vehicles are extensively taught by way of not apprehending anything.🔽Because of the emptiness of ultimate reality,🔽because of the emptiness of the unlimited,🔽because of the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end,

original: theg pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan to //
translated: because of the emptiness of nonrepudiation,🔽because of the emptiness of inherent existence,🔽because of the emptiness of all phenomena,🔽because of the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics,🔽because of the emptiness of nonapprehending,🔽because of the emptiness of nonentities,

original: phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir /
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir /
translated: and because of the emptiness of the entityness of nonentities,

original: theg @388a *// pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan to //
analyzed: theg @388a *// pa gsum po dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis rgya cher bstan to //
translated: the three vehicles are extensively taught by way of not apprehending anything.”

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan to
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan to
translated: For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the perfection of concentration, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of patience, the perfection of morality, and the perfection of giving have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha have been taught.

original: // phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir /
analyzed: // phyi stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi phyir /
translated: For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects has been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of paths has been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of all bases has been taught.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan to //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams yongs su bzung ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams 'jig rten thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i spobs pa can du 'gyur ba'i bar dag kyang bstan to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of the aspects of the path has been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of paths, and the knowledge of all bases have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of paths, the knowledge of all bases, and the knowledge of the aspects of the path have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the perfection of giving, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening have been taught.🔽For the sake of the perfection of wisdom, Subhūti, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha have been taught.

original: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste nyi shu gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i le'u ste nyi shu gsum pa'o ////

translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, and the sons of gods in the great billionfold world system, from the Catur­mahā­rāja­kāyika realm of gods up to the Akaniṣṭha realm of gods, emanated divine coral tree flowers and scattered them over the lord buddhas, the bodhisattva great beings, the community of monks, the elder Subhūti, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: me tog de dag gis bcom ldan 'das dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / gnas brtan rab 'byor dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la gtor /

analyzed: nges par ma skyes pa gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin no //
translated: That which is definitely not born is not the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /

original: kye ma @391a *//

original: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /

analyzed: snyam mo // de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //

analyzed: de de bzhin te /

analyzed: kye ma rab 'byor 'di btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la / chos nyid kyang ston pa ni shes rab zab pa yin no //

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la /

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to the Lord:

analyzed: ji ltar na gnas brtan rab 'byor 'di btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /

original: chos nyid kyang ston par bgyid pa lags /
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston par bgyid pa lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

analyzed: gzugs ni btags pa tsam ste /

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
translated: What is a mere designation is the intrinsic nature,

original: rab 'byor ni de dang mi 'gal bar ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor ni de dang mi 'gal bar ston to //
translated: and Subhūti teaches without contradicting that.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni btags pa tsam ste /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are mere designations.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
translated: What is a mere designation is the intrinsic nature,

original: rab 'byor ni de dang mi 'gal bar ston to //

analyzed: gang 'gal ba med pa de ni /

analyzed: rab 'byor ston par byed cing /

analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched @391b rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched @391b rnams dang / de bzhin du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang /
translated: Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, and likewise, the perfection of generosity, the perfection of conduct, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence,

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / de bzhin du nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang / de bzhin du dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang /
translated: the perfection of concentration, the perfection of wisdom, and likewise, inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, and likewise, the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong pa rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa rnams dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: the correct understandings, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, and similarly, the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'ang btags pa tsam mo; ;koo shi ka /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / de bzhin du rgyun du zhugs pa'ang btags pa tsam mo; ;koo shi ka /
translated: the state of a worthy one, the state of a pratyekabuddha, and similarly, one who has entered the stream is a mere designation, Kauśika.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang btags pa tsam ste /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyang btags pa tsam ste /
translated: One who has entered the stream, one bound for one rebirth, one bound for two rebirths, a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha, and a tathāgata, worthy one, perfectly complete buddha are mere designations.

original: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
analyzed: btags pa tsam gang yin pa de ni chos nyid yin pas /
translated: What is a mere designation is the real nature.

original: rab 'byor ni de dang mi 'gal bar ston to //
analyzed: rab 'byor ni de dang mi 'gal bar ston to //
translated: Subhūti teaches without contradicting that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: chos @392a *// nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba med pa yin pa /
analyzed: chos @392a *// nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba med pa yin pa /
translated: That which is reality is non-contradictory.

original: 'gal ba med pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is non-contradictory

original: rab 'byor ston par byed cing mi 'gal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor ston par byed cing mi 'gal bar byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: is taught by Subhūti, Kauśika, because he teaches without contradiction.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: it is like this:

original: rab 'byor ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
analyzed: rab 'byor ni btags pa dang yang mi 'gal la /
translated: Subhūti does not contradict designations

original: chos nyid kyang ston to //
analyzed: chos nyid kyang ston to //
