original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just so.

original: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad btags pa tsam du bstan pa de ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos thams cad btags pa tsam du bstan pa de ni de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the Blessed One has taught that all phenomena are mere designations, so it is.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig par byas la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar chos thams cad btags pa tsam du rig par byas la /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslab par bya'o //
translated: and should train in the perfection of wisdom.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la mi slob bo //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni gzugs la mi slob bo //
translated: bodhisattva mahāsattvas who train like this do not train in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi slob bo //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la mi slob bo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: He does not train in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhing /

original: gang la bslab par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang la bslab par bya ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness as something on which to train.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob bo //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob bo // de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su @392b mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par rjes su @392b mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you ask why, it is because he does not see the perfection of giving as something on which to train.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi slob bo //
translated: Similarly, they do not train in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol phyin pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because they do not see the perfection of wisdom in which they should train.

original: nang stong pa nyid la'ang mi slob bo //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid la'ang mi slob bo //
translated: They do not train in inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi slob bo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang mi slob bo //
translated: up to they do not train in the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i nang stong pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i nang stong pa nyid kyang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong la /
translated: Why is that?🔽It is because they do not see inner emptiness in which they should train,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: up to they do not see the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature in which they should train.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la'ang mi slob bo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la'ang mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /
translated: He does not train in the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the ten powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang mi slob bo //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la'ang mi slob bo //
translated: or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid la'ang mi slob bo //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar @393a *//
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid la'ang mi slob bo // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar @393a *//
translated: He does not train in the result of stream enterer, the result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, or a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: la'ang mi slob bo //
analyzed: la'ang mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar des gang la bslab par bya ba'i rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not see any dharma in which he should train, up to or in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said to the venerable Su­bhūti,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: de ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: why do the bodhisattva great beings not see form?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Why do they not see feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness?

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Similarly, why do they not see the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening?

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not to be seen.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag yang dag par rjes su mi mthong /
translated: Why is the knowledge of all aspects not to be seen?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: koo shi ka /'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: koo shi ka /'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: “Kauśika, it is because form is empty of form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: and feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol @393b tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol @393b tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyis stong /
translated: Similarly, the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, and the dharmas on the side of awakening are empty of the dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis stong /
translated: the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar ni /
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is empty of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzugs stong pa nyid ni gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob /
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid ni gzugs stong pa nyid la mi slob /
translated: the emptiness of form is not trained in the emptiness of form,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid la mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi stong pa nyid la mi slob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects is not trained in the emptiness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang stong pa nyid la mi slob pa de ni gnyis su dbyer med par stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid la mi slob pa de ni gnyis su dbyer med par stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
translated: one who is not trained in emptiness is trained in emptiness that is not divided into two.

original: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
translated: That is the training in the emptiness of form, which is not divided into two.

original: de bzhin du de ni gnyis su dbyer med par rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du de ni gnyis su dbyer med par rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, that is the training in the knowledge of all aspects, which is not divided into two.

original: koo shi ka ;gang gnyis su dbyer med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa dang / gnyis su dbyer med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa de ni gnyis su dbyer med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang slob pa yin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka ;gang gnyis su dbyer med par gzugs stong pa nyid la slob pa dang / gnyis su dbyer med par rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la slob pa de ni gnyis su dbyer med par sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang slob pa yin no //
translated: Kauśika, the training in the emptiness of form, which is not divided into two, and the training in the knowledge of all aspects, which is not divided into two, is also the training in the perfection of giving, which is not divided into two.

original: de bzhin du gnyis su dbyer med par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi @394a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis su dbyer med par tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi @394a *//
translated: Similarly, it is the training in the perfection of morality, which is not divided into two, the training in the perfection of patience, which is not divided into two, the training in the perfection of perseverance, which is not divided into two,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang slob pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang slob pa yin no //
translated: the training in the perfection of concentration, which is not divided into two, and the training in the perfection of wisdom, which is not divided into two.

original: gnyis su dbyer med par nang stong pa nyid la'ang slob pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med par nang stong pa nyid la'ang slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in inner emptiness, which is not divided into two.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang slob pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar la'ang slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature, which is not divided into two.🔽They train in the applications of mindfulness, which are not divided into two.

original: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la slob pa yin no; ;gnyis su dbyer med par yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang /
analyzed: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la slob pa yin no; ;gnyis su dbyer med par yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang /
translated: They train in the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam rnams la slob pa yin no //
translated: limbs of awakening, and path, which are not divided into two.

original: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams la slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in the ten powers, fearlessnesses, detailed and thorough knowledges, and distinct attributes of a buddha, which are not divided into two.

original: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gnyis su dbyer med par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la slob pa yin no //
translated: They train in the result of stream enterer, which is not divided into two.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang sangs rgyas nyid dang / sangs rgyas nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa yin no //
translated: He trains in the fruit of stream-entry, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, the state of a worthy one, the state of a solitary buddha, buddhahood, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gnyis su dbyer med par sangs rgyas nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de ni /
analyzed: gnyis su dbyer med par sangs rgyas nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la slob pa de ni /
translated: He trains in buddhahood and the knowledge of all aspects without making any division into two.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la slob pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la slob pa yin no //
translated: He trains in the incalculable, immeasurable dharmas of a buddha.

original: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos @394b grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la slob pa de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas kyi chos @394b grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams la slob pa de ni gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or decrease form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or decrease feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: In the same way, he does not train in order to increase or diminish the elements and the sense-spheres.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or diminish dependent origination.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or diminish the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar bya ba dang /🔽'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or diminish the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: He does not train in order to increase or diminish the applications of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po; ;nang stong pa nyid 'phel bar bya ba dang /🔽'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir @395a *//
analyzed: de bzhin du yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / dbang po rnams dang / stobs rnams dang / byang chub kyi yan lag rnams dang / lam 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob po; ;nang stong pa nyid 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir @395a *//
translated: “Similarly, they do not train in the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path in order to increase or decrease them. They do not train in inner emptiness in order to increase or decrease it.

original: mi slob bo //
analyzed: mi slob bo //
translated: They do not train in outer emptiness, inner and outer emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness, great emptiness, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of the compounded, the emptiness of the uncompounded, limitless emptiness, or the emptiness of inherent existence in order to increase or decrease it.🔽They do not train in the emptiness of all things in order to increase or decrease it.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: They do not train in the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, or omniscience in order to increase or decrease them.

original: gang gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa dang / gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang /🔽med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
analyzed: gang gzugs 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa dang / gang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du 'phel bar bya ba dang / 'grib par bya ba'i phyir mi slob pa de ni gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //
translated: They do not train in order to increase or decrease form, and they do not train in order to increase or decrease , up to and including omniscience.🔽They do not train in order to appropriate or reject form.🔽They do not train in order to appropriate or reject feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo //🔽de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung ba dang / med pa'i bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo ////
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo // de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung ba dang / med pa'i bya ba'i phyir mi slob bo ////
translated: They do not train in order to appropriate or reject , up to and including omniscience.🔽The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines🔽The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gzugs yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
translated: Why is it that bodhisattva great beings do not train in order to grasp at form or to ungrasp it?

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su gzung ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
translated: Why is it that they do not train in order to grasp at feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness or to ungrasp them?

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung @395b ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su gzung @395b ba dang / med par bya ba'i phyir mi slob /
translated: Similarly, why is it that they do not train in order to grasp at , up to and including the knowledge of all aspects or to ungrasp them?

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs la yongs su gzung ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la yongs su gzung ba med do //
translated: it is because there is no grasping at form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir gzugs la gzugs yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because form does not grasp at form because of inner emptiness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su gzung ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yongs su gzung ba med do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: There is no appropriation in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness. And why?

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par shes pa la rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness does not appropriate consciousness, because of the emptiness of internal phenomena.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang yongs su gzung ba med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la'ang yongs su gzung ba med do //
translated: similarly, up to there is no appropriation in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid kyi phyir rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the knowledge of all aspects does not appropriate the knowledge of all aspects, because of the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of inherent nature, the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-existence.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: all phenomena are not appropriated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings who train like that in the knowledge of all aspects will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra then said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas /
translated: when bodhisattva great beings train like that,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ram /
translated: having trained in the perfection of wisdom, will they go forth to the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rab @396a *// 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab @396a *// 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni chos thams cad yongs su gzung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bslabs nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings train like that, having trained in the perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending any dharma, they will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽🔽

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na chos thams cad yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhing /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / de ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na chos thams cad yongs su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin zhing /
translated: Śāriputra said, Venerable Subhūti,

original: med par bya ba'i phyir ma yin par bslabs nas /
analyzed: med par bya ba'i phyir ma yin par bslabs nas /
translated: how can bodhisattva great beings who train like that, who train not to grasp at all dharmas and not to reject them,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur /🔽rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: reach the knowledge of all aspects?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Subhūti replied, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: do not see the origination, cessation, taking up, or putting down of form, nor do they see its defilement or purification, its decrease or increase.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because form is not existent by the intrinsic nature of form.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba @396b dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba @396b dang; kun nas nyon mongs pa dang /
translated: in the same way, bodhisattva great beings do not see the arising, cessation, taking up, or laying down of feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness;

original: rnam par byang ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: they do not see defilement or purification, decrease or increase, of consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because consciousness is not existent by the intrinsic nature of consciousness.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang /🔽so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang; rnam par byang ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi skye ba dang / 'gag pa dang / blang ba dang / dor ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang; rnam par byang ba dang /
translated: Similarly, he does not see the arising or cessation, taking up or putting down, defilement or purification,🔽decrease or increase of the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment, all the emptinesses, the powers, the fearlessnesses,

original: 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'grib pa dang / 'phel ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: the detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, or the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of all aspects is not the nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang /🔽'phel ba med par slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems @397a *//
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / 'grib pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med par slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems @397a *//
translated: in that way, the bodhisattva great beings who train in all phenomena as non-arisen, unceasing, unrenounceable, unobtainable, uncontaminated, and unpurified,🔽and as neither decreasing nor increasing,

original: dpa' chen po ni slob pa med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing /
analyzed: dpa' chen po ni slob pa med pa dang / nges par 'byung ba med pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la slob cing /
translated: train in the perfection of wisdom without training and without leaving, and

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: they will go forth to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods, said to venerable Śāriputra,🔽“Venerable Śāriputra,

original: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: btsun pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,🔽where should we look for the perfection of wisdom?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya; sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya; sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o //
translated: should be looked for in Subhūti’s chapter.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: the noble Śāriputra

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: says this:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: ‘Kauśika,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: the perfection of wisdom

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyi le'u las btsal bar bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: should be looked for in the chapter of the venerable Subhūti.’

original: ci de 'phags pa khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs yin nam /
analyzed: ci de 'phags pa khyod kyi byin gyi rlabs yin nam /
translated: Is that your authorization, noble one?

original: de khyod kyi mthu yin nam /
analyzed: de khyod kyi mthu yin nam /
translated: Is that your power?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: de ni kho bo'i mthu ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni kho bo'i mthu ma yin no //
translated: that is not my power.

original: de ni kho bo'i byin gyi rlabs ma yin no //🔽brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: de ni kho bo'i byin gyi rlabs ma yin no // brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: That is not my authorization.”🔽Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'o na de su'i mthu yin /
analyzed: 'o na de su'i mthu yin /
translated: “Well then, whose power is this?”

original: de su'i byin gyi rlabs yin /
analyzed: de su'i byin gyi rlabs yin /
translated: “Whose blessing is this?”

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: this is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
translated: This is the blessing of the Tathāgata.”

original: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
analyzed: brgya byin gyis smras pa /
translated: Śakra said,

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: chos thams cad ni byin gyi @397b rlabs med pa yin na /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni byin gyi @397b rlabs med pa yin na /
translated: since all phenomena are without blessing,

original: ci'i phyir 'di skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di skad du 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: why do you say, ‘This is the power of the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
translated: This is the blessing of the Tathāgata’?”

original: zhes smra / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: zhes smra / rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: koo shi ka /🔽de de bzhin no //
analyzed: koo shi ka / de de bzhin no //
translated: “Kauśika,🔽it is so,

original: de de bzhin te /🔽byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: de de bzhin te / byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: it is just as you have said.🔽The Tathāgata is not apprehended in the reality that is without blessing,

original: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: nor is the Tathāgata apprehended apart from the reality that is without blessing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med /
translated: The reality of the Tathagata is not perceived as a blessing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na'ang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med do //🔽de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa las gud na'ang byin gyi rlabs med pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med do // de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: The reality of the Tathagata is not perceived as a blessing apart from the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is not perceived in suchness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do //🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: Suchness is not perceived in the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is not perceived in the suchness of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do //🔽gzugs kyi chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do // gzugs kyi chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: The suchness of form is not perceived in the Tathagata.🔽The Tathagata is not perceived in the reality of form.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi chos nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang gzugs kyi chos nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: The reality of form is not perceived in the Tathagata.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: The Tathagata is not perceived in the suchness of feeling, perception, volitional formations, or consciousness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dmigs @398a *//🔽su med do //🔽rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dmigs @398a *// su med do // rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: and the Tathāgata is not apprehended in the suchness of consciousness.🔽The Tathāgata is not apprehended in the real nature of consciousness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: and the real nature of consciousness is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo rnams dang /
translated: Similarly, the Tathāgata is not apprehended in the suchness of the constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the perfections, all the emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the gateways to liberation,🔽the powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, the distinct attributes of a buddha, or in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: stobs rnams dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang; sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: and the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended in the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: The suchness of the tathāgatas up to the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la; de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid dmigs su med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la; de bzhin gshegs pa la'ang rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid dmigs su med do //
translated: The suchness of the tathāgatas is not apprehended in the dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects, and the dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects is not apprehended in the tathāgatas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni gzugs kyi chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Kauśika,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: the dharmatā of the tathāgatas is not associated with and not disassociated from the dharmatā of form.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Kauśika,

original: tshor ba dang / @398b 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / @398b 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the dharmatā of the tathāgatas is not associated with and not disassociated from the dharmatā of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not associated with and not disassociated from anything other than the dharmatā of form.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not non-endowed.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with the dharmatā of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness, nor is it non-endowed.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with the suchness of form,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it non-endowed.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with the suchness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it non-endowed.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with anything other than the suchness of form,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it non-endowed.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: It is not endowed with anything other than the suchness of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin la /
translated: nor is it non-endowed.

original: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: In the same way, the dharmatā of the Tathāgata is not conjoined with the dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it disjoined from it.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The dharmatā of the Tathāgata is not conjoined with the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: nor is it disjoined from it.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi chos nyid ma yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The dharmatā of the Tathāgata is not conjoined with anything other than the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ma @399a *//
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid ma @399a *//
translated: nor is it disjoined from it.

original: yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: yin pa gzhan dang ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The dharmatā of the Tathāgata is not conjoined with anything other than the dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: nor is it disjoined from it.

original: koo shi ka /🔽de ltar chos thams cad ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: koo shi ka / de ltar chos thams cad ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Kauśika,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pas na byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshul gyis de ni de'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin pas na byin gyi rlabs med pa'i tshul gyis de ni de'i mthu yin no //
translated: because all dharmas are neither conjoined nor disjoined, that is their power, in the manner of not blessing.

original: de ni de'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
analyzed: de ni de'i byin gyi rlabs yin no //
translated: That is its blessing.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gang khyod 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: gang khyod 'di skad du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang nas btsal bar bya zhes zer ba ni /
translated: you asked, “Where should a bodhisattva great being seek the perfection of wisdom?”

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: you should not seek it in form.

original: gzugs las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not seek it other than in form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not seek it in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: You should not seek it other than in consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / gzugs gang yin pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: it is because all those dharmas—that is, the perfection of wisdom, and that form, and that feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness—are not conjoined and not disjoined; they are not manifest; they do not have an entity; they do not have no entity.

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not non-endowed.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa /
translated: It is not physical.

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: It is not demonstrable.

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: It is not obstructive.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the same in being without defining characteristics.

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni khams rnams dang / skye mched @399b rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni khams rnams dang / skye mched @399b rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: Moreover, Kauśika, bodhisattva great beings should not search for the perfection of wisdom in the constituents, the sense fields, or dependent origination.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not search for it anywhere other than dependent origination.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang /
translated: They should not search for it in the perfections, all the emptinesses, the dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten tathāgata powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, or the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las kyang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: it should not be sought in the knowledge of all aspects,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan du'ang btsal bar mi bya'o //
translated: and it should not be sought anywhere other than the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa dang / btsal ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa dang / btsal ba gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Because all those dharmas—namely, the perfection of wisdom, the knowledge of all aspects, and the seeking—are not conjoined and not disjoined,

original: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing /🔽gzugs can ma yin pa /
analyzed: mi ldan pa'ang ma yin zhing / gzugs can ma yin pa /
translated: they are immaterial,

original: bstan du med pa /🔽thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bstan du med pa / thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: they cannot be shown,🔽they have one mark, which is no mark.

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i phyir ro; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: koo shi ka /🔽'di ltar gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: koo shi ka / 'di ltar gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: Kauśika,🔽it is because form is not the perfection of wisdom,

original: gzugs las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: gzugs las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: and the perfection of wisdom is not elsewhere apart from form,

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: Similarly, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @400a *//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @400a *//
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than consciousness.

original: med / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: Similarly, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: The suchness of form is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than the suchness of form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: The suchness of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than the suchness of consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la; rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is not the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is not other than the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la; gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /🔽tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la; gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: The true dharmic nature of form is not the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is not other than the true dharmic nature of form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med /
translated: The true dharmic nature of feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is not the perfection of wisdom, and the perfection of wisdom is not other than the true dharmic nature of consciousness.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi @400b chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar gyi @400b chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin la /
translated: The intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is also not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: Kauśika,

original: 'di ltar chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag thams cad ni yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because all these dharmas do not exist and cannot be apprehended.

original: de ltar chos thams cad yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med pas na /
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad yod pa ma yin zhing dmigs su med pas na /
translated: Thus, since all dharmas do not exist and cannot be apprehended,

original: gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //🔽gzugs las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //🔽gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no // gzugs las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do // gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: form is also not the perfection of wisdom.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than form.🔽The suchness of form is also not the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than the suchness of form.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: The dharmatā of form is also not the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than the dharmatā of form.

original: de bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In the same way, connect this:

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: the knowledge of all aspects is also not the perfection of wisdom.🔽The perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: The suchness of the knowledge of all aspects is also not the perfection of wisdom.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi de bzhin nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not somewhere other than the suchness of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin no //
translated: The dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects is also not the perfection of wisdom.

original: @401a *// rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
analyzed: @401a *// rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos nyid las gud na'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med do //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is not other than the dharmatā of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
analyzed: de nas lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyis /
translated: Then Śatakratu, head of the gods,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces smras so // btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: said this to the venerable Su­bhūti:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba'o //🔽btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni che ba'o // btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is a great perfection.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa'o //🔽btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni tshad med pa'o // btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is an immeasurable perfection.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Venerable Su­bhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpag tu med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni dpag tu med pa'o //
translated: this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva great beings is an infinite perfection.

original: btsun pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: btsun pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa pha rol tu phyin pa 'di ni mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: This perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas is limitless.

original: de la bslabs nas rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
analyzed: de la bslabs nas rgyun du zhugs pa rnams kyis kyang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob bo //
translated: Having trained in it, the stream enterers have attained the fruit of stream enterer,

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: will attain it, and are attaining it.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis kyang dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba rnams dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnams dang / dgra bcom pa rnams kyis kyang dgra bcom pa nyid thob bo //
translated: The once-returners, non-returners, and arhats have attained arhatship,

original: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro //🔽rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
analyzed: thob bo // 'thob par 'gyur ro // rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang /
translated: will attain it, and are attaining it.🔽The pratyekabuddhas

original: rang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par @401b sangs rgyas so //🔽mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub mngon par rdzogs par @401b sangs rgyas so // mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: have fully awakened to their pratyekabuddha enlightenment,

original: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will fully awaken, and are fully awakening.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas shing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byas shing /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

original: koo shi ka /

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i le'u zhes bya ste nyi shu bzhi pa'o ////

analyzed: 'di lta ste /

translated: Oh, how well it has been explained!🔽Oh, how well this Dharma has been explained!🔽Oh, how well the reality of this Dharma has been explained!

analyzed: ji skad smras pa de bzhin te /

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar de dag kyang @406b de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du gzung bar bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
