translated: Because this perfection of wisdom extensively teaches the three vehicles, the Śrāvakayāna, the Pratyekabuddhayāna, and the Bodhisattva­yāna.”

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med la /
translated: The Thus-Gone One cannot be observed apart from the perfection of generosity.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: The Thus-Gone One cannot be observed apart from the perfection of discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of diligence, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of insight.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: The Thus-Gone One cannot be observed apart from inner emptiness, up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: The Thus-Gone One cannot be observed apart from the applications of mindfulness.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: the right efforts, the legs of miraculous power, the faculties, the powers, the limbs of awakening, and the path are not the Thus-Gone One.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa rnams dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su med /
translated: The ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a buddha are not the Thus-Gone One.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su @407a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar las gud na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa dmigs su @407a *//
translated: The knowledge of all aspects is not the Thus-Gone One.

original: med la / lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: med la / lha'i bu dag /
translated: Gods,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos de dag la slob cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa chos de dag la slob cing /
translated: great bodhisattva beings train in those dharmas, from the perfection of generosity up to the perfection of wisdom,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la'ang slob par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la'ang slob par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: and they train in the knowledge of path aspects up to the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: Gods,

original: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar spyod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dang mi 'bral bar spyod pa de dag ni /
translated: Therefore, those bodhisattva great beings who practice without being separated from this perfection of wisdom

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: should be called ‘tathāgatas.’

original: lha'i bu dag /🔽gang gi tshe nga de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi thad na rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor padma can zhes bya ba'i tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'dug cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag / gang gi tshe nga de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad kyi thad na rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor padma can zhes bya ba'i tshong 'dus kyi dbus na 'dug cing mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Divine princes,🔽when I was in the middle of the market town called Padmāvatī, the royal capital of the Tathāgata Dīpaṃkara, and was not separated from the perfection of generosity, not separated from the perfection of morality,

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral bar ma gyur /
translated: They were not separated from the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, or the perfection of wisdom.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang bral bar ma gyur /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang bral bar ma gyur /
translated: They were not separated from inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang bral bar ma gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar dang bral bar ma gyur /
translated: up to and were not separated from the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang bral bar ma gyur /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams dang bral bar ma gyur /
translated: They were not separated from the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams dang @407b bral bar ma gyur /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam rnams dang @407b bral bar ma gyur /
translated: and were not separated from the right efforts, legs of miraculous power, faculties, powers, limbs of awakening, or path.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / gzungs kyi sgo thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang /
translated: the four concentrations, the four immeasurables, the four formless absorptions, all the meditative stabilities, all the dhāraṇī gateways, the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four fearlessnesses,

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang yang bral bar ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos dpag tu med pa gzhan dag dang yang bral bar ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: the four detailed and thorough knowledges, the eighteen distinct qualities of the buddhas, great love, great compassion, and other limitless buddhadharmas.

original: lha'i bu dag /
analyzed: lha'i bu dag /
translated: “Divine princes,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad des nga la bram ze'i khye'u khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa'i 'og tu bskal pa bzang po la 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad des nga la bram ze'i khye'u khyod ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'das pa'i 'og tu bskal pa bzang po la 'jig rten gyi khams 'di nyid du /
translated: the tathāgata, the arhat, the perfectly enlightened buddha Dīpaṃkara prophesied to me, ‘Young brahmin, in the future, after countless eons have passed, in the fortunate eon, in this very world system,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba /
translated: the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the perfectly enlightened Buddha Śākyamuni,

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: the one with knowledge and feet,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the one who has gone to bliss,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: the one who knows the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo bsgyur ba /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo bsgyur ba /
translated: the charioteer who tames people,

original: bla na med pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa /
translated: the unsurpassed one,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the teacher of gods and humans,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das su 'gyur ro zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to //
translated: the Buddha, the Blessed One.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das la lha'i bu de dag gis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the gods said to the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs yongs su mi @408a *//
analyzed: ci tsam du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di gzugs yongs su mi @408a *//
translated: to what extent does this perfection of wisdom not apprehend and not reject form,

original: 'dzin / mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: 'dzin / mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: and does not apprehend and not reject feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness?”

original: mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin /
analyzed: mi 'dor ba'i tshul dang / de bzhin du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar du yongs su mi 'dzin /
translated: Similarly, up to the knowledge of all aspects is not grasped and not rejected.

original: mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: mi 'dor ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: Up to the knowledge of all aspects is not grasped and not rejected.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar lags so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mthun par yongs su 'dzin pa ni ngo mtshar lags so //
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ concordant grasping of the knowledge of all aspects is amazing.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang /🔽'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams 'dus te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams dang / rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu rnams dang / 'og min gyi bar gyi lha'i bu rnams 'dus te /
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing that the fourfold assembly of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, the four great kings, the sons of the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings,

original: 'dug par thugs su chud nas de dag thams cad dbang por bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dug par thugs su chud nas de dag thams cad dbang por bzhag ste /
translated: and the sons of the gods up to the Akaniṣṭha realm had gathered and were seated, established them all in the state of being a lord

original: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and said this to Śakra, Lord of the Gods:

original: koo shi ka /
analyzed: koo shi ka /
translated: “Kauśika,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'am /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'am /
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva,
